DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR THE OPERATION OF THE GRAND PORTAGE BAND OF CHIPPEWA'S (GRAND PORTAGE) CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS WHILE GIVING IT GREATER FLEXIBILITY TO ADDRESS ITS HIGHEST ENVIRONMENTAL PRIORITIES, IMPROVE ENVIRONMENTAL PERFORMANCE, ACHIEVE SAVINGS AND STRENGTHEN THE PARTNERSHIP BETWEEN GRAND PORTAGE AND EPA. THIS AGREEMENT FUNDS TRIBAL CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS FOR CLEAN WATER ACT SECTION 319, GENERAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAM, AND CLEAN AIR ACT SECTION 105 ACTIVITIES. THE WORK INCLUDES OUTPUTS AND OUTCOMES ASSOCIATED WITH MANAGING CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS WHICH INCLUDE ACTIVITIES TO PROTECT AND MAINTAIN ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM CAPACITY BUILDING, WATER QUALITY, AND AIR QUALITY. ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE ASSISTING WITH ADMINISTRATIVE OVERSIGHT, DEVELOPING PROJECT PROPOSALS, ATTENDING TRAININGS, PARTICIPATING IN MEETINGS ABOUT ENVIRONMENTAL CONDITIONS WHICH AFFECT THE TRIBE, CONTINUING IMPLEMENTATION AND EXPANSION OF A TRIBAL SOLID WASTE PROGRAM, COLLABORATION WITH SCHOOLS, COMMUNITIES, AND LOCAL AND STATE GOVERNMENTAL AGENCIES, MONITORING AIR QUALITY, AND OTHER RELATED ACTIONS.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE PROGRESS REPORTS ON TRAININGS AND MEETINGS, MAPS AND BRIEFINGS, EXAMPLES OF FLYERS AND POSTERS, AND PRELIMINARY SAMPLE REPORTS.

THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES FROM THIS AGREEMENT ARE PROTECTED WATER, LAND, AND AIR QUALITY, COOPERATIVE RELATIONSHIPS BETWEEN STATES, TRIBES, AND EPA, INCREASED SOLID WASTE CAPACITY, MINIMIZED NPS POLLUTION, AND CONTINUED MONITORING.

DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM ARE THE CITIZENS OF GRAND PORTAGE.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR THE OPERATION OF THE PRAIRIE ISLAND INDIAN COMMUNITY (PIIC) CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS WHILE GIVING IT GREATER FLEXIBILITY TO ADDRESS ITS HIGHEST ENVIRONMENTAL PRIORITIES, IMPROVE ENVIRONMENTAL PERFORMANCE, ACHIEVE ADMINISTRATIVE SAVINGS, AND STRENGTHEN THE PARTNERSHIP BETWEEN PIIC AND EPA. THIS AGREEMENT FUNDS TRIBAL PROGRAMS TO CARRY OUT GENERAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAM, CLEAN WATER ACT SECTION 106, AND CLEAN WATER ACT SECTION 319 ACTIVITIES. THE WORK INCLUDES OUTPUTS AND OUTCOMES ASSOCIATED WITH MANAGING CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS WHICH INCLUDE ACTIVITIES TO PROTECT AND MAINTAIN ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM CAPACITY BUILDING AND WATER QUALITY.ACTIVITIES:SPECIFICALLY, PIIC WILL PROTECT THE QUALITY OF THE TRIBE'S WATER, LAND, AND AIR RESOURCES BY BUILDING AND ENHANCING THE BASIC INFRASTRUCTURE OF AN ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM AND MAINTAIN ADEQUATE MEASURES FOR THE PREVENTION AND CONTROL OF SURFACE AND GROUNDWATER POLLUTION FROM BOTH POINT AND NON-POINT SOURCES. THE TRIBE WILL CONTINUE TO MAINTAIN AND ENHANCE A CORE ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION PROGRAM TO ENABLE THE TRIBE TO RESPOND TO THREATS TO HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT AND WORK COOPERATIVELY WITH FEDERAL AND OTHER GOVERNMENTAL JURISDICTIONS ON ISSUES OF CONCERN.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE WORK INCLUDES OUTPUTS AND OUTCOMES ASSOCIATED WITH MANAGING CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS WHICH INCLUDE DELIVERABLES TO PROTECT AND MAINTAIN ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM CAPACITY BUILDING AND WATER QUALITY. THROUGH WORK WITH EPA, THE PRAIRIE ISLAND INDIAN COMMUNITY PLANS TO MONITOR, ANALYZE AND DOCUMENT VARIOUS BIOLOGICAL, CHEMICAL, AND PHYSICAL PARAMETERS TO BETTER MANAGE RESERVATION WATERS AND OTHER INTERRELATED RESOURCES.  THE TRIBE WILL CONTINUE TO MAINTAIN AND ENHANCE A CORE ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION PROGRAM TO ENABLE THE TRIBE TO RESPOND TO THREATS TO HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT AND WORK COOPERATIVELY WITH FEDERAL AND OTHER GOVERNMENTAL JURISDICTIONS ON ISSUES OF CONCERN. THE DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS AGREEMENT ARE THE CITIZENS OF PIIC.

SPECIFICALLY, HIC WILL PROTECT THE QUALITY OF THE TRIBE'S WATER, LAND, AND AIR RESOURCES BY BUILDING AND ENHANCING THE BASIC INFRASTRUCTURE OF AN ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM AND MAINTAIN ADEQUATE MEASURES FOR THE PREVENTION AND CONTROL OF SURFACE AND GROUNDWATER POLLUTION FROM BOTH POINT AND NON-POINT SOURCES.

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION PROVIDES FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $1,000,075.00 TO THE STATE OF ALABMA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT (ADEM) FOR THE OPERATION OF THE ALABAMA'S CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS WHILE GIVING IT GREATER FLEXIBILITY TO ADDRESS ITS HIGHEST ENVIRONMENTAL PRIORITIES, IMPROVE ENVIRONMENTAL PERFORMANCE, ACHIEVE ADMINISTRATIVE SAVINGS AND STRENGTHEN THE PARTNERSHIP BETWEEN ADEM AND EPA. THIS AGREEMENT WILL FUND STATEWIDE PROGRAMS TO SUPPORT AIR, WATER, AND LAND. ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES PERFORMED INCLUDE BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO ISSUING, PERMITS, CONDUCTING INSPECTIONS, EVALUATING COMPLIANCE, ENFORCEMENT ACTIONS, MONITORING AND DATA REPORTING, AND PROVIDING TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE FOR AIR 105, BEACH MONITORING, PUBLIC WATER SUPPLY SYSTEMS, UNDERGROUND INJECTION CONTROL, WATER 106, WATER 319, SUPPLEMENTAL MONITORING, BROWNFIELDS, RCRA, PCB, AND EXCHANGE NETWORK.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:EXPECTED OUTPUT/OUTCOMES INCLUDE TIMELY AND APPROPRIATE ENFORCEMENT ACTIONS, FACILITIES HAVING ADEQUATE PERMITS AND CONTROLS IN PLACE, COLLECTING AND REPORTING QUALITY DATA, ALL TO SUPPORT THE GOAL OF A CLEANER, HEALTHIER ENVIRONMENT. THESE EFFORTS WILL REDUCE RISK, IMPROVE ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION, AND RESTORE AND SUPPORT RECREATIONAL AND PUBLIC HEALTH ISSUES THAT CONTRIBUTE TO HEALTHY ECONOMIES. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM ARE THE CITIZENS OF THE STATE OF ALABAMA.

DESCRIPTION:

THIS AGREEMENT CONTAINS ACTIVITIES THAT COMPLEMENT EXISTING PUBLIC WATER SYSTEM SUPERVISION (PWSS) ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM GRANT. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO IMPROVE DRINKING WATER QUALITY IN VIRGINIA BY DEVELOPING NEW TOOLS REPLACING TWO CRITICAL FUNCTIONALITIES OF THE CURRENT DATA SYSTEM. SPECIFICALLY THE RECIPIENT WILL USE MULTIPURPOSE FUNDS TO PROCURE A CONTACT TO DEVELOP THE TOOLS THAT WILL: (1) COMPILE STATISTICS FOR ADDITIONAL PERFORMANCE METRICS RELATED TO COMPLIANCE AND ENFORCEMENT AS REQUESTED BY THE VIRGINIA OFFICE OF THE STATE INSPECTOR GENERAL AND FOR FEDERAL REPORTINGAND AND (2) SUPPORT DRINKING WATER SAMPLING BY PROVIDING PRIVATE AND STATE PRINCIPLE LABORATORIES NECESSARY INFORMATION TO FACILITATE SAMPLING BY WATER SYSTEMS, IDENTIFYING SAMPLE RECORD ERRORS, AND CHECKING LABORATORY CERTIFICATION STATUS TO ENSURE SAMPLES ARE ANALYZED BY CERTIFIED LABORATORIES. DELIVERABLES TO EPA INCLUDE SEMI-ANNUAL AND FINAL REPORTS CONCERNING PROJECT PROGRESS AND FUNDING USAGE. SINCE THIS GRANT PROVIDES FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO VIRGINIA TO PERFORM ITS AUTHORIZED RESPONSIBILITIES FOR IMPLEMENTING THE PWSS PROGRAM AND OVERSEEING PUBLIC WATER SYSTEMS ACROSS THE STATE TO ENSURE SAFE DRINKING WATER, DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE ALL STATE RESIDENTS AND PUBLIC WATER SYSTEMS THAT RECEIVE AND PROVIDE QUALITY DRINKING WATER.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR THE OPERATION OF THE PENNSYLVANIA DEPARTMENT OF LABOR AND INDUSTRY'S CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS, WHILE GIVING IT GREATER FLEXIBILITY TO ADDRESS ITS HIGHEST ENVIRONMENTAL PRIORITIES, IMPROVE ENVIRONMENTAL PERFORMANCE, ACHIEVE ADMINISTRATIVE SAVINGS, AND STRENGTHEN THE PARTNERSHIP BETWEEN THE PENNSYLVANIA DEPARTMENT OF  LABOR AND INDUSTRY AND EPA. IT FUNDS STATEWIDE PROGRAMS TO: PROTECT AND MAINTAIN THE ADMINISTRATION AND ENFORCEMENT OF THE LEAD-BASED PAINT ACCREDITATION PROGRAM, TRAIN INDIVIDUALS, AND ESTABLISH WORKPLACE STANDARDS IN RESIDENTIAL HOUSING BUILT BEFORE 1978.ACTIVITIES:THE ANTICIPATED ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE MANAGING CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS, WHICH INCLUDE THE TRAINING OF INDIVIDUALS ENGAGED IN LEAD-BASED PAINT ABATEMENTS, ACCREDITATION OF TRAINING PROVIDERS, AND CERTIFICATION OF CONTRACTORS, WHICH WILL RESULT IN A REDUCTION OF EXPOSURE TO LEAD RESULTING IN IMPROVED PUBLIC HEALTH. STAFF WILL REVIEW AND ISSUE LEAD CERTIFICATIONS TO PROPERLY TRAINED AND TESTED LEAD PROFESSIONALS, ENSURING THAT CERTIFICATIONS ARE ENTERED INTO THE CERTIFICATION DATABASE AND MAKE AVAILABLE A LISTING OF CERTIFIED FIRMS ON THE WEBSITE. DURING THE GRANT PERIOD, STAFF/DESIGNEE WILL AUDIT LEAD BASED PAINT INITIAL AND REFRESHER TRAINING COURSES CONDUCTED WITHIN THE STATE TO ENSURE THAT COURSES ARE FOLLOWING PROPER REQUIREMENTS.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES FROM THIS AGREEMENT ARE THE TRAINING OF INDIVIDUALS ENGAGED IN LEAD-BASED PAINT ABATEMENTS, ACCREDITATION OF TRAINING PROVIDERS, AND CERTIFICATION OF CONTRACTORS, WHICH WILL RESULT IN A REDUCTION OF EXPOSURE TO LEAD RESULTING IN IMPROVED PUBLIC HEALTH. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM ARE THE CITIZENS OF PENNSYLVANIA, ESPECIALLY CHILDREN, AS LEAD POISONING IN CHILDREN CAUSES NUMEROUS HEALTH PROBLEMS.

FEDERAL FUNDS OF $592,000 ARE CONTINGENT UPON AVAILABILITY.

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR THE OPERATION OF THE PUERTO RICO DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE'S CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS WHILE GIVING IT GREATER FLEXIBILITY TO ADDRESS ITS HIGHEST ENVIRONMENTAL PRIORITIES, IMPROVE ENVIRONMENTAL  PERFORMANCE, ACHIEVE ADMINISTRATIVE SAVINGS AND STRENGTHEN THE PARTNERSHIP BETWEEN PRDOA AND EPA. DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR THE OPERATION OF THE NEW YORK STATE DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL CONSERVATION'S CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS WHILE GIVING IT GREATER FLEXIBILITY TO ADDRESS ITS HIGHEST ENVIRONMENTAL PRIORITIES, IMPROVE ENVIRONMENTAL PERFORMANCE, ACHIEVE ADMINISTRATIVE SAVINGS AND STRENGTHEN THE PARTNERSHIP BETWEEN NYSDEC AND EPA. THIS AGREEMENT FUNDS STATE CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS PROMOTING ENHANCED PROTECTION OF HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT THROUGH REDUCED PESTICIDE EXPOSURE TO THE PUBLIC, AGRICULTURAL WORKERS AND HANDLERS, PROTECTION OF WATER RESOURCES FROM PESTICIDES, AND PROTECTION OF ENDANGERED SPECIES.ACTIVITIES:THIS AGREEMENT FUNDS PESTICIDE REGULATORY AND ENFORCEMENT ACTIVITIES INCLUDING: TRAINING AND CERTIFYING PESTICIDE APPLICATORS, CONDUCTING WORKER PROTECTION ACTIVITIES TO PROTECT FARMWORKERS AND COMMUNITIES, PROTECTING WATER QUALITY BY IDENTIFYING PESTICIDES OF INTEREST, IDENTIFYING LOCATIONS THAT NEED PROTECTION DUE TO THE LOCATION OF ENDANGERED SPECIES AND THEIR HABITAT, PROTECTING PUBLIC HEALTH FROM UNREGISTERED PESTICIDE PRODUCTS AND MISUSE, MONITORING FOR COMPLIANCE IN THE FIELD AND ENFORCING EPA PESTICIDE LABELS WHEN NEEDED, AND CONDUCTING OUTREACH AND EDUCATION TO THE REGULATED COMMUNITY AND THE PUBLIC.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT INCLUDE BETTER PROTECTION OF PUBLIC HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT THROUGH 1) INCREASED OUTREACH AND EDUCATION ON PROPER PESTICIDE USE TO THE REGULATED COMMUNITY AND THE PUBLIC TO REDUCE RISK, 2) PROPER TRAINING AND CERTIFICATION OF PESTICIDE APPLICATORS, 3) MONITORING FOR COMPLIANCE BY PERFORMING INSPECTIONS, 4) RESPONDING TO TIPS AND COMPLAINTS, AND 5) TAKING ENFORCEMENT ACTION WHEN NEEDED. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM ARE THE CITIZENS OF NEW YORK, THE REGULATED COMMUNITY AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC.

THIS AGREEMENT FUNDS STATE CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS FOR:  (1) THE ADMINISTRATION OF THE LEAD-BASED PAINT ACCREDITATION PROGRAM, TRAINING, INDIVIDUALS, AND ESTABLISHING WORKPLACE STANDARDS IN RESIDENTIAL HOUSING BUILT BEFORE 1978. THIS AGREEMENT WILL RESULT IN ENHANCED PROTECTION OF HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT AND WILL BENEFIT THE CITIZENS OF PUERTO RICO.  THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR PRDNER TO ENSURE THAT INDIVIDUALS AND FIRMS ENGAGED IN LEAD-BASED PAINT ACTIVITIES ARE IN COMPLIANCE WITH THE REGULATIONS THUS REDUCING LEAD EXPOSURE RISKS.ACTIVITIES:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR PRDNER TO ENSURES THAT INDIVIDUALS AND FIRMS ENGAGED IN LEAD-BASED PAINT ACTIVITIES ARE IN COMPLIANCE WITH THE REGULATIONS THUS REDUCING LEAD EXPOSURE RISKS IN THE FOLLOWING AREAS:
-CERTIFICATION OF ABATEMENT FIRMS
-THIRD-PARTY EXAMINATIONS
-OUTREACH ACTIVITIES
-ACCREDITATION OF TRAINING PROVIDERS
-ABATEMENT PROJECT NOTIFICATIONS
-INDIVIDUAL CERTIFICATIONS
-INSPECTIONS OF LEAD HAZARD CONTROL ACTIVITIES
-ENFORCEMENT CASE PREPARATION 
-TRAINING PROVIDER AUDITS

DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS AGREEMENT ARE THE CITIZENS OF PUERTO RICO INCLUDING THE PUBLIC, ESPECIALLY CHILDREN, AS LEAD POISONING IN CHILDREN CAUSES NUMEROUS HEALTH PROBLEMS.

OTHER OUTCOMES INCLUDE ENHANCED POLICY AND REGULATIONS BASED ON WATER QUALITY STANDARD IMPLEMENTATION ACTIVITIES, INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF WATER QUALITY STANDARDS, AND INCREASED TRIBAL ABILITY TO ENFORCE AND MEET WATER QUALITY GOALS.

THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $2,741,288 TO  THE FLORIDA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION TO SUPPORT ITS CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS WHICH INCLUDE ACTIVITIES TO PROTECT AND MAINTAIN THE ENVIRONMENT BY REDUCING AIR POLLUTION AND IMPROVING WATER QUALITY THROUGH PERMITTING, ENFORCEMENT, AND COMPLIANCE EFFORTS AND WATERSHED MANAGEMENT; REDUCING HAZARDOUS WASTE & IMPROVING WASTE MANAGEMENT PRACTICES; PRESERVING UNDERGROUND DRINKING WATER SOURCES; AND ENSURING PROTECTION OF PUBLIC WATER SUPPLY SYSTEMS.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR THE OPERATION OF THE SOKAOGON CHIPPEWA COMMUNITY (SCC) CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS WHILE GIVING IT GREATER FLEXIBILITY TO ADDRESS ITS HIGHEST ENVIRONMENTAL PRIORITIES, IMPROVE ENVIRONMENTAL PERFORMANCE, ACHIEVE ADMINISTRATIVE SAVINGS, AND STRENGTHEN THE PARTNERSHIP BETWEEN SCC AND EPA. THIS AGREEMENT FUNDS TRIBAL PROGRAMS TO CARRY OUT CLEAN WATER ACT SECTION 106, GENERAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAM, AND CLEAN WATER ACT SECTION 319 ACTIVITIES. THE WORK INCLUDES OUTPUTS AND OUTCOMES ASSOCIATED WITH MANAGING CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS WHICH INCLUDE ACTIVITIES TO PROTECT AND MAINTAIN ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM CAPACITY BUILDING AND WATER QUALITY. ACTIVITIES:SPECIFICALLY, SCC WILL PROTECT THE QUALITY OF THE TRIBE'S WATER, LAND, AND AIR RESOURCES BY BUILDING AND ENHANCING THE BASIC INFRASTRUCTURE OF AN ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM AND MAINTAIN ADEQUATE MEASURES FOR THE PREVENTION AND CONTROL OF SURFACE AND GROUNDWATER POLLUTION FROM BOTH POINT AND NON-POINT SOURCES. THE TRIBE WILL CONTINUE TO MAINTAIN AND ENHANCE A CORE ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION PROGRAM TO ENABLE THE TRIBE TO RESPOND TO THREATS TO HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT AND WORK COOPERATIVELY WITH FEDERAL AND OTHER GOVERNMENTAL JURISDICTIONS ON ISSUES OF CONCERN.
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE WORK INCLUDES OUTPUTS AND OUTCOMES ASSOCIATED WITH MANAGING CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS WHICH INCLUDE DELIVERABLES TO PROTECT AND MAINTAIN ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM CAPACITY BUILDING AND WATER QUALITY. THROUGH WORK WITH EPA, THE SOKAOGON CHIPPEWA COMMUNITY PLANS TO MONITOR, ANALYZE AND DOCUMENT VARIOUS BIOLOGICAL, CHEMICAL, AND PHYSICAL PARAMETERS TO BETTER MANAGE RESERVATION WATERS AND OTHER INTERRELATED RESOURCES.  THE TRIBE WILL CONTINUE TO MAINTAIN AND ENHANCE A CORE ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION PROGRAM TO ENABLE THE TRIBE TO RESPOND TO THREATS TO HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT AND WORK COOPERATIVELY WITH FEDERAL AND OTHER GOVERNMENTAL JURISDICTIONS ON ISSUES OF CONCERN. THE DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS AGREEMENT ARE THE CITIZENS OF SCC.

THIS AGREEMENT FUNDS TRIBAL PROGRAMS TO: BUILD ENVIRONMENTAL CAPACITY, PROTECT AND IMPROVE WATER QUALITY AND DRINKING WATER; CONTROL PESTICIDES; AND CONTROL HAZARDOUS WASTE. THIS IS A PERFORMANCE PARTNERSHIP GRANT (PPG) TO THE LAC DU FLAMBEAU BAND OF LAKE SUPERIOR CHIPPEWA INDIANS (LDF) CONSISTING OF FUNDS FOR THE CLEAN WATER ACT (CWA) SECTION 106 AND SECTION 319, AS WELL AS A WETLAND PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT GRANT (CWA SECTION 104(B)3). THIS AWARD WILL ENABLE LDF TO CONTINUE TO PROMOTE THE DEVELOPMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION OF WATERSHED BASED PLANS FOCUSING ON WATERSHEDS WITH WATER QUALITY IMPAIRMENTS CAUSED BY NON-POINT SOURCES.  THE ACTIVITIES WILL RESULT IN IMPROVED WATER QUALITY IN IMPAIRED WATERS AND TO ENSURE ALL TRIBAL WATERS ARE CLEAN AND SAFE.

THIS IS A PERFORMANCE PARTNERSHIP GRANT (PPG) TO THE BAY MILLS INDIAN COMMUNITY (BMIC) CONSISTING OF FUNDS FOR THE CLEAN WATER ACT (CWA) SECTION 106 AND SECTION 319. THIS AWARD WILL ENABLE BMIC TO BUILD TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL CAPACITY, AND IMPLEMENT THE WATER RESOURCE AND NONPOINT SOURCE PROGRAMS. THESE ACTIVITIES WILL PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT.

THIS AWARD IS A PERFORMANCE PARTNERSHIP GRANT (PPG) COMBINING FUNDS UNDER THE CLEAN AIR ACT (CAA) SECTION 105, CLEAN WATER ACT SECTION (CWA) SECTION 106, CWA SECTION 319, AND THE INDIAN GENERAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAM (GAP).  THIS PROJECT WILL ENABLE THE TRIBE TO PLAN, DEVELOP, AND ESTABLISH THE CAPABILITY FOR IMPLEMENTING ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION PROGRAMS. THE TRIBE WILL ALSO SUSTAIN THE PROGRAMMATIC ACTIVITIES OF THE FOREST COUNTY POTAWATOMI COMMUNITY'S (FCPC) TRIBAL AIR PROGRAM AND CONTINUE TO IMPLEMENT THE WATER RESOURCE AND NONPOINT SOURCE PROGRAMS.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR THE OPERATION OF THE CONFEDERATED TRIBES OF THE UMATILLA INDIAN RESERVATION (CTUIR)'S CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS WHILE GIVING IT GREATER FLEXIBILITY TO ADDRESS ITS HIGHEST ENVIRONMENTAL PRIORITIES, IMPROVE ENVIRONMENTAL PERFORMANCE, ACHIEVE ADMINISTRATIVE SAVINGS, AND STRENGTHEN THE PARTNERSHIP BETWEEN CTUIR AND EPA. WORK TO BE ACCOMPLISHED INCLUDES CONTINUED ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM CAPACITY BUILDING, WATER QUALITY MONITORING, NONPOINT SOURCE (NPS) WATER POLLUTION WORK, AND UPDATING THE TRIBE'S RIVER VISION WHICH GUIDES THE TRIBE'S DIRECTION ON STEWARDSHIP OF RIVERINE RESOURCES. $100,000 IN NATIONAL CLEAN WATER ACT (CWA) SECTION 319 COMPETITIVE FUNDING AWARDED UNDER EPA-OW-OWOW-22-01 IS OBLIGATED AS PART OF THIS SUPPLEMENTAL FUNDING ACTION. ADDITIONALLY, $99,577 IN NATIONAL TRIBAL CWA 319 COMPETITIVE FUNDING AWARDED UNDER EPA-OW-OWOW-20-01 IS RE-OBLIGATED AS PART OF THIS SUPPLEMENTAL FUNDING ACTION.ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED UNDER THIS GRANT INCLUDE DISSEMINATING INFORMATION ON THE TRIBAL CLIMATE ADAPTATION PLAN (CAP) TO TRIBAL MEMBERS, TESTING SURFACE WATER QUALITY, IDENTIFYING ADDITIONAL RESTORATION AND PROTECTION PROJECTS FOR NONPOINT SOURCE POLLUTION MANAGEMENT EFFORTS, CONTINUED TRIBAL COORDINATION WITH THE OREGON DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY (ODEQ) ON OFF-RESERVATION TOTAL MAXIMUM DAILY LOAD (TMDL) CRITERIA, AND CONDUCTING LITERATURE REVIEWS OF PUBLICATIONS RELEVANT TO CTUIR'S RIVER VISION, AMONG OTHER ACTIVITIES.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND ASSOCIATED OUTCOMES INCLUDE EXPANDING TRIBAL CAPACITY TO ADDRESS ONGOING AND FUTURE CLIMATE CHANGE IMPACTS, REPORTING ON FLOODPLAIN INUNDATING EVENTS, IMPROVING WATER QUALITY WITHIN THE UMATILLA BASIN INCLUDING STREAM TEMPERATURES THAT SUPPORT BENEFICIAL USE OF FISH AND AQUATIC LIFE, AND RESTORING FLOODPLAIN ACCESS BY RECONNECTION THE BIRCH CREEK CHANNEL. ADDITIONALLY, CTUIR WILL REVISE ITS QUALITY ASSURANCE PROGRAM PLAN (QAPP) FOR SURFACE WATER QUALITY MONITORING. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE TRIBAL MEMBERS.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR THE OPERATION OF THE NEZ PERCE TRIBE'S CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS WHILE GIVING IT GREATER FLEXIBILITY TO ADDRESS ITS HIGHEST ENVIRONMENTAL PRIORITIES, IMPROVE ENVIRONMENTAL PERFORMANCE, ACHIEVE SAVINGS, AND STRENGTHEN THE PARTNERSHIP BETWEEN NEZ PERCE TRIBE AND EPA. THIS AGREEMENT FUNDS TRIBAL CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS FOR CLEAN AIR ACT, INDOOR RADON AND MULTIPURPOSE GRANTS TO TRIBES.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE IMPLEMENTATION OF CLEAN AIR ACT OF PROGRAMS FOR THE PREVENTION AND CONTROL OF AIR POLLUTION ON THE NEZ PERCE RESERVATION, INCLUDING IMPLEMENTATION OF THE FEDERAL AIR RULES FOR RESERVATIONS FEDERAL IMPLEMENTATION PLAN (FARR FIP) ACTIVITIES WITHIN THE EXTERIOR BOUNDARIES OF THE 1863 NEZ PERCE RESERVATION.  
TO DO SO, THE NEZ PERCE TRIBE WILL PARTICIPATE IN LOCAL, REGIONAL, AND NATIONAL AIR QUALITY INITIATIVES, ORGANIZATIONS, MEETINGS, CONFERENCES, AND TRAININGS THAT CONTRIBUTE TO AIR QUALITY IMPROVEMENT BY INCREASING THE CAPACITY OF THE TRIBE AND THE TRIBE'S AIR QUALITY (AQ) PROGRAM TO EFFECTIVELY ADDRESS AIR QUALITY TECHNICAL AND POLICY CONCERNS AND AIR POLLUTION ISSUES. CONTINUE TO CONDUCT AIR QUALITY MONITORING AND EMISSION INVENTORY ACTIVITIES, FARR IMPLEMENTATION ACTIVITIES, FARR COMPLIANCE ASSISTANCE AND MONITORING AS WELL AS TO COMPLETE UPDATES TO THE NEZ PERCE TRIBE FARR WEBSITE AND BURN PERMIT DATABASE TO SUPPORTING SMOKE MANAGEMENT AND BURN PERMIT PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION UNDER THE NEZ PERCE TRIBE/EPA FARR DELEGATION AGREEMENT. THE TRIBE WILL ALSO WORK TO REDUCE EXPOSURE TO RADIATION AND IMPROVE INDOOR AIR BY LIMITING UNNECESSARY RADIATION EXPOSURE TO A ACHIEVE A HEALTHIER INDOOR AIR QUALITY, ESPECIALLY FOR VULNERABLE POPULATIONS. IN ADDITION, THE TRIBE WILL ENGAGE WITH THE COMMUNITY TO SUPPORT IMPLEMENTATION OF AQ PROGRAMS THAT PREVENT AND CONTROL AIR POLLUTION BY PROMOTING AWARENESS OF ISSUES, HEALTH CONCERNS, AND BEST MANAGEMENT PRACTICES, AND BY ASSESSING COMMUNITY CONCERNS ABOUT AIR QUALITY AND OPPORTUNITIES FOR SOLUTIONS.
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES ARE TO ACCURATELY CHARACTERIZED AQ WITHIN THE NEZ PERCE RESERVATION AND TO MAKE SURE ITS CONDITION AND THREATS ARE UNDERSTOOD BY THE TRIBE, EPA, AND OTHERS. THE DELIVERABLES INCLUDE MAINTAINING AND MONITORING THE AIR QUALITY NETWORK TO MINIMIZE OFF-LINE DAYS, AS WELL AS THE SUBMISSION OF AQ DATA TO EPA'S AIR QUALITY SYSTEM. THE NEZ PERCE TRIBE WILL ISSUE BURN PERMITS AND DECLARE BURN BANDS, AS APPROPRIATE. OTHER DELIVERABLES INCLUDE WORKING WITH EPA TO SUCCESSFULLY IMPLEMENT THE DELEGATION AGREEMENT AND THE INSPECTOR CREDENTIALS AGREEMENT ON THE NEZ PERCE RESERVATION. SUBMISSION OF AN ANNUAL INSPECTION PLAN AND QUARTERLY INSPECTION REPORTS TO EPA SUMMARIZING COMPLAINTS, RESPONSES, INSPECTIONS, AND INSPECTOR CREDENTIALS-RELATED TRAININGS COMPLETED. A REPORT ON THE NUMBER OF INDOOR AIR QUALITY ASSESSMENTS, AND ALL EDUCATION AND OUTREACH CONDUCTED, INCLUDING THE NUMBER AND TYPE OF OUTREACH, WILL ALSO BE SUBMITTED. 

THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES ARE TO PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT BY IMPLEMENTING PROGRAMS FOR THE PREVENTION AND CONTROL OF AIR POLLUTION ON THE NEZ PERCE RESERVATION WITH THE GOAL OF OVERALL IMPROVED AIR QUALITY REFLECTED BY REDUCED PARTICULATE AND TOXIC AIR POLLUTANT LEVELS AND REDUCTIONS IN RISKS TO HUMAN HEALTH FROM AIR POLLUTION. THE TRIBES' EDUCATION, OUTREACH, AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE ACTIVITIES WILL RESULT IN A CONTRIBUTION TO AIR QUALITY AND HUMAN HEALTH IMPROVEMENT BY CHANGING HUMAN BEHAVIOR, THEREBY PROTECTING HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT. THE EXPECTED OUTCOME OF THE NEZ PERCE TRIBE FARR WEBSITE IS A ROBUST, RELIABLE, EFFICIENT, AND EFFECTIVE WEBSITE AND DATA MANAGEMENT SYSTEM THAT MAINTAINS RECORDS, DATA, AND INFORMATION FOR BURN PERMIT APPLICATION AND ISSUANCE, REGISTRATION FEE PAYMENTS, PUBLIC AND BURN PERMITTEE COMMUNICATION, COMPLAINTS, INVES

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR THE OPERATION OF THE SPOKANE TRIBE OF INDIANS (STOI)'S CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS WHILE GIVING IT GREATER FLEXIBILITY TO ADDRESS ITS HIGHEST ENVIRONMENTAL PRIORITIES, IMPROVE ENVIRONMENTAL PERFORMANCE, ACHIEVE ADMINISTRATIVE SAVINGS, AND STRENGTHEN THE PARTNERSHIP BETWEEN THE TRIBE AND EPA. WORK TO BE ACCOMPLISHED INCLUDES CONTINUED ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM CAPACITY BUILDING, WATER QUALITY MONITORING, MEASURING INDOOR AIR QUALITY AND TESTING RADON LEVELS IN TRIBAL HOMES AND GOVERNMENT BUILDINGS, EDUCATION AND OUTREACH OF NONPOINT SOURCE POLLUTION SOURCES, AND CLIMATE CHANGE ASSESSMENT AND VULNERABILITY PLANNING. $85,512 IN NATIONAL CLEAN WATER ACT (CWA) SECTION 319 COMPETITIVE FUNDING AWARDED UNDER EPA-OW-OWOW-22-01 IS OBLIGATED AS PART OF THIS SUPPLEMENTAL FUNDING ACTION.ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED UNDER THIS GRANT INCLUDE IMPLEMENTING THE TRIBE'S WATER QUALITY MONITORING STRATEGY, PARTICIPATING IN LOCAL WATERSHED GROUPS, CONDUCTING RADON TESTING IN HOMES AND GOVERNMENT BUILDINGS, CONDUCTING CWA SECTION 401 CERTIFICATION REVIEWS AS REQUESTED, AND MONITORING DISCHARGE FROM THE WATER TREATMENT PLANT ALONG BLUE CREEK AND THE SPOKANE ARM OF LAKE ROOSEVELT. ADDITIONAL ACTIVITIES DEVELOPING GEOGRAPHIC INFORMATION SYSTEMS (GIS) FOR COLLECTING AND ORGANIZING ENVIRONMENTAL DATA, MONITORING AND REPORTING ILLEGAL DUMPING, AMONG OTHER ACTIVITIES.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED UNDER THIS GRANT INCLUDE IMPLEMENTING THE TRIBE'S WATER QUALITY MONITORING STRATEGY, PARTICIPATING IN LOCAL WATERSHED GROUPS, CONDUCTING RADON TESTING IN HOMES AND GOVERNMENT BUILDINGS, CONDUCTING CWA SECTION 401 CERTIFICATION REVIEWS AS REQUESTED, AND MONITORING DISCHARGE FROM THE WATER TREATMENT PLANT ALONG BLUE CREEK AND THE SPOKANE ARM OF LAKE ROOSEVELT. ADDITIONAL ACTIVITIES DEVELOPING GEOGRAPHIC INFORMATION SYSTEMS (GIS) FOR COLLECTING AND ORGANIZING ENVIRONMENTAL DATA, MONITORING AND REPORTING ILLEGAL DUMPING, AMONG OTHER ACTIVITIES.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR THE OPERATION OF THE COEUR D'ALENE TRIBE'S CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS WHILE GIVING IT GREATER FLEXIBILITY TO ADDRESS ITS HIGHEST ENVIRONMENTAL PRIORITIES, IMPROVE ENVIRONMENTAL PERFORMANCE, ACHIEVE ADMINISTRATIVE SAVINGS, AND STRENGTHEN THE PARTNERSHIP BETWEEN THE TRIBE AND EPA. WORK TO BE ACCOMPLISHED INCLUDES CONTINUED ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM CAPACITY BUILDING, CLIMATE CHANGE ADAPTATION ASSESSMENT AND RESEARCH, CONTINUED POINT AND NON-POINT SOURCE WATER QUALITY MONITORING, AND ENSURING THE TIMELY SURVEYING AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES. $99,846 IN NATIONAL CLEAN WATER ACT (CWA) SECTION 319 COMPETITIVE FUNDING AWARDED UNDER EPA-OW-OWOW-22-01 IS OBLIGATED AS PART OF THIS SUPPLEMENTAL FUNDING ACTION.ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED UNDER THIS GRANT INCLUDE CONTINUED COORDINATION WITH TRIBAL DEPARTMENTS ON ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES, RESEARCHING CLIMATE CHANGE ADAPTATION OPPORTUNITIES AND OBSTACLES, DEVELOPING AND REVISING WATER QUALITY STANDARDS TO SUBMIT TO THE ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY (EPA) FOR APPROVAL, WORKING WITH THE TRIBAL PUBLIC TO IDENTIFY SITES THAT MAY REQUIRE CLEANUP, AND IMPLEMENTING A TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM TO ADDRESS ASSESSMENT, CLEANUP, AND REDEVELOPMENT OF BROWNFIELD SITES, AMONG OTHER ACTIVITIES.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND ASSOCIATED OUTCOMES INCLUDE DEVELOPING AN ADAPTATION PLAN FOR CURRENT AND FUTURE CLIMATE IMPACTS, INCREASING TRIBAL KNOWLEDGE OF REGIONAL AND NATIONAL ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES, ENHANCING WORKING RELATIONSHIPS WITH LOCAL AND STATE PARTNERS, REVIEWING AND PROVIDING REVISED WATER QUALITY STANDARDS, INCREASED KNOWLEDGE OF TRIBAL WATERS TO ASSIST THE TRIBE IN MAKING SOUND DECISIONS REGARDING WATER RESOURCE MANAGEMENT, INCREASED COMMUNITY AWARENESS OF TRIBAL SITE-SPECIFIC CLEANUP SITES, AND INCREASED PUBLIC KNOWLEDGE OF ACTIVITIES THAT CAN IMPACT HEALTH OR THE ENVIRONMENT, AMONG OTHER OUTCOMES. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE TRIBAL MEMBERS.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR THE OPERATION OF THE SAUK-SUIATTLE INDIAN TRIBE'S CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS WHILE GIVING IT GREATER FLEXIBILITY TO IMPROVE ENVIRONMENTAL PERFORMANCE, ACHIEVE ADMINISTRATIVE SAVINGS AND STRENGTHEN THE PARTNERSHIP BETWEEN THE TRIBE AND EPA. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE WORK INCLUDES OUTPUTS AND OUTCOMES ASSOCIATED WITH MANAGING CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS AND ACTIVITIES TO PROTECT AND MAINTAIN AIR, WATER, LAND AND DATA QUALITY. DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR THE OPERATION OF THE KOOTENAI TRIBE OF IDAHO'S (KTOI) CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS WHILE GIVING IT GREATER FLEXIBILITY TO ADDRESS ITS HIGHEST ENVIRONMENTAL PRIORITIES, IMPROVE ENVIRONMENTAL PERFORMANCE, ACHIEVE ADMINISTRATIVE SAVINGS AND STRENGTHEN THE PARTNERSHIP BETWEEN THE TRIBE AND EPA. WORK TO BE ACCOMPLISHED INCLUDES CONTINUED ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM CAPACITY BUILDING, DEVELOPING AND EXTENDING ENVIRONMENTAL COLLABORATION WITH STATE AND LOCAL PARTNERS, AIR QUALITY MONITORING, AND REDUCING AIR POLLUTION EMISSIONS.ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED UNDER THIS GRANT INCLUDE PERFORMING ENVIRONMENTAL NEEDS ASSESSMENTS, PARTICIPATION IN AIR QUALITY TRAININGS AND CONFERENCES, CONTINUED ASSESSMENT AND GROWTH OF THE TRIBE'S RECYCLING AND SOLID WASTE PROGRAMS, AND PARTICIPATING IN VARIOUS LOCAL AND STATE ENVIRONMENTAL WORKGROUPS. IN ADDITION, KOOTENAI TRIBE WILL GATHER AND RECORD AIR QUALITY DATA, PARTICIPATE IN THE FEDERAL AIR RULES FOR RESERVATIONS (FARR) RULE REVISION PROCESS, AND HOLD AN ANNUAL COMMUNITY RESOURCE DAY, AMONG OTHER COMMITMENTS.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND ASSOCIATED OUTCOMES INCLUDE PRODUCING A REVISED TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH STRATEGIC PLAN, PROVIDING INPUT AND INFORMATION TO EPA ON THE EFFICACY OF NEW RULES AND UPDATES TO THE FEDERAL AIR RULES FOR RESERVATIONS (FARR), INSTALLING AIR SENSORS IN TWO LOCATIONS ON RESERVATION LANDS, AND PROVIDING AIR QUALITY DATA ON VARIOUS PLATFORMS. THESE DELIVERABLES ALL LEAD TO THE SHARED OUTCOMES OF IMPROVED AIR QUALITY IN THE REGION AND IMPROVED HEALTH OF TRIBAL MEMBERS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE TRIBAL MEMBERS.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING SUPPORT FOR THE OPERATION OF THE UMATILLA TRIBE'S CONTINUING AIR QUALITY MANAGEMENT PROGRAM WHILE GIVING GREATER FLEXIBILITY TO ADDRESS THE TRIBE'S HIGHEST ENVIRONMENTAL PRIORITIES, IMPROVE ENVIRONMENTAL PERFORMANCE, ACHIEVE ADMINISTRATIVE SAVINGS, AND STRENGTHEN THE PARTNERSHIP BETWEEN THE TRIBE AND EPA. 

ACTIVITIES INCLUDE IMPLEMENTATION AND MANAGEMENT OF THE FEDERAL AIR RULES FOR RESERVATIONS, AIR QUALITY MONITORING AND ASSESSMENT, AND AIR QUALITY EDUCATION AND OUTREACH. 

THESE ACTIVITIES WILL PROTECT PUBLIC HEALTH BY ENSURING THAT THE NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARDS ARE BEING PROTECTED ON AND NEAR THE UMATILLA RESERVATION.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR THE OPERATION OF THE EASTERN SHAWNEE TRIBE OF OKLAHOMA'S CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS WHILE GIVING IT GREATER FLEXIBILITY TO ADDRESS ITS HIGHEST ENVIRONMENTAL PRIORITIES, IMPROVE ENVIRONMENTAL PERFORMANCE, ACHIEVE ADMINISTRATIVE SAVINGS AND STRENGTHEN THE PARTNERSHIP BETWEEN THE QUAPAW TRIBE AND EPA. THIS AGREEMENT FUNDS TRIBAL PROGRAMS TO: THE WORK INCLUDES OUTPUTS AND OUTCOMES ASSOCIATED WITH MANAGING CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS WHICH INCLUDE ACTIVITIES TO PROTECT AND MAINTAIN WATERS IN TRIBAL COMMUNITIES, MONITOR AIR SOURCES AND DEVELOP PROGRAM CAPACITY.ACTIVITIES:SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL BUILD CAPACITY OF OFFICE STAFF TO LEARN AND ADDRESS ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES, PROVIDE OUTREACH, IMPLEMENT SOLID WASTE MANAGEMENT PRACTICES AND STRATEGIES TO PREVENT ILLEGAL DUMPING AND  MAINTAIN TRIBAL SURFACE WATER PROGRAM.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE QUARTERLY PROGRESS REPORTS, ANNUAL FEDERAL FINANCIAL REPORT (FFR), QUALITY MANAGEMENT PLAN (QMP), SURFACE WATER MONITORING QUALITY ASSURANCE PROJECT PLAN (QAPP) AND GEOGRAPHIC INFORMATION SYSTEM/GLOBAL POSITIONING SYSTEM QUALITY ASSURANCE PROJECT PLAN (GIS/GPS QAPP). THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES FROM THIS AGREEMENT ARE GRANTEE WILL MAINTAIN A TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL PRESENCE; CONDUCT SAMPLING AND ANALYSIS; CONTINUE ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATIONAL OUTREACH; SOLID WASTE COLLECTION ACTIVITIES. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM ARE THE CITIZENS OF THE EASTERN SHAWNEE TRIBE AS THE PRIMARY AND THE LOCAL COMMUNITY AS THE SECONDARY.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR THE OPERATION OF THE PUEBLO OF SANTA ANA'S CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS WHILE GIVING IT GREATER FLEXIBILITY TO ADDRESS ITS HIGHEST ENVIRONMENTAL PRIORITIES, IMPROVE ENVIRONMENTAL PERFORMANCE, ACHIEVE SAVINGS AND STRENGTHEN THE PARTNERSHIP BETWEEN PUEBLO OF SANTA ANA AND EPA. THIS AGREEMENT FUNDS TRIBAL CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS FOR AIR AND THE GENERAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAM.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE CONTINUING TO BUILD CAPACITY TO MANAGE THE PUEBLO'S ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS AND TO IMPLEMENT NEW AND EXPANDED PROGRAMS CONSISTENT WITH THE EPA-TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL PLAN (ETEP) SUBMITTED TO EPA FOR THE FISCAL YEARS 2017-2021 AND FUTURE ETEPS.  THE FUNDING RECEIVED THROUGH THE INDIAN GENERAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAM ALLOWS FOR THE ADMINISTRATION OF THE PUEBLO'S ENVIRONMENTAL OFFICE AT THE DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES AND SUPPORTS ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS THROUGH ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION/COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND GIS MAPPING AND ANALYSIS. THE FUNDING RECEIVED THROUGH THE AIR PROGRAM ALLOWS FOR CAPACITY BUILDING TO PROTECT AIR QUALITY AND GATHERING BASELINE AIR QUALITY INFORMATION, REVIEW AIR PERMITS, AND CONTINUE TO IDENTIFY, PLAN FOR, AND IMPLEMENT APPROPRIATE AND REALISTIC AIR QUALITY CONTROL STRATEGIES FOR THE PUEBLO OF SANTA ANA.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:SEMI-ANNUAL PROGRESS REPORTS, ANNUAL FEDERAL FINANCIAL REPORT (FFR), QUALITY MANAGEMENT PLAN (QMP), AND GEOGRAPHIC INFORMATION SYSTEM/GLOBAL POSITIONING SYSTEM (GIS/GPS) QUALITY ASSISTANCE PROJECT PLAN (QAPP). THE INTENDED BENEFICIARY IS THE SANTA ANA PUEBLO.

DESCRIPTION: THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR THE OPERATION OF TAOS PUEBLO'S CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS WHILE GIVING IT GREATER FLEXIBILITY TO ADDRESS ITS HIGHEST ENVIRONMENTAL PRIORITIES, IMPROVE ENVIRONMENTAL PERFORMANCE, ACHIEVE ADMINISTRATIVE SAVINGS AND STRENGTHEN THE PARTNERSHIP BETWEEN THE TAOS PUEBLO AND EPA. THIS AGREEMENT FUNDS TRIBAL PROGRAMS FOR ADMINISTRATIVE CAPACITY BUILDING AND TO CARRY OUT ITS MONITORING PROGRAM TO MAINTAIN, PROTECT, AND IMPROVE THE WATER QUALITY OF ITS RIVERS, LAKES, STREAMS, GROUNDWATER, AND OTHER WATERBODIES. THE ENVIRONMENTAL BENEFITS OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE PREVENTING DEGRADATION OF UNIMPAIRED WATERBODIES AND REDUCING THE NUMBER OF IMPAIRED WATERBODIES ON TRIBAL LANDS. ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES INCLUDE MANAGEMENT OF OFFICE, PLANNING, COMMUNITY OUTREACH, AND COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT ACTIVITIES, INCLUDING BUILDING CAPACITY OF THE ENVIRONMENTAL DEPARTMENT THROUGH PARTICIPATION IN ENVIRONMENTAL MEETINGS AND TRAININGS, MAPPING AREAS OF EROSION AND ILLEGAL DUMPSITES, INITIATING COMPOSTING PROGRAM, CONDUCTING ENVIRONMENTAL OUTREACH, NONPOINT SOURCE PLANNING, ENGAGING WITH THE ASSOCIATED WATERSHED-BASED PLAN FOR THE LARGER AREA AND DEVELOPING A PUEBLO-SPECIFIC WATERSHED BASED PLAN FOR THE RIO PUEBLO DE TAOS, PHOTO MONITORING OF PREVIOUS NONPOINT SOURCE PROJECTS, MONITORING WATER QUALITY, CLEAN WATER ACT SECTION 401 AND NATIONAL POLLUTANT DISCHARGE ELIMINATION SYSTEM (NPDES) PERMIT REVIEW AND CERTIFICATION, AND SHARING WITH EPA AND THE PUBLIC THE RIO PUEBLO DE TAOS WATER QUALITY DATA AND WATERBODY ASSESSMENTS; COMPLETION OF WATER QUALITY STANDARDS REVISION; SELECTION OF APPROPRIATE NUTRIENT MODEL FOR IDENTIFYING POLLUTION SOURCES; REVISE THE PUEBLO'S NONPOINT SOURCE MANAGEMENT PLAN.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ENVIRONMENTAL BENEFITS OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE PREVENTING DEGRADATION OF UNIMPAIRED WATERBODIES AND REDUCING THE NUMBER OF IMPAIRED WATERBODIES ON TRIBAL LANDS. INTENDED BENEFICIARY IS TAOS PUEBLO AND TAOS COMMUNITY.
SIMI-ANNUAL REPORTS, QUALITY MANAGEMENT PLAN(QMP), QUALITY ASSURANCE PROJECT PLAN(QAPP),COPIES OF OFFICE NEWS LETTERS, GAINED ENVIRONMENTAL CAPACITY; TRIBAL ASSESSMENT REPORT ANALYZING COLLECTED WATER QUALITY DATA TO ASSESS THE TRIBE'S SURFACE WATERS UTILIZING THEIR EPA-APPROVED WATER QUALITY STANDARDS; UPLOAD OF DATA TO EPA'S WATER QUALITY EXCHANGE DATABASE TO ALLOW FOR RETENTION AND SHARING OF COLLECTED DATA; PARTICIPATION IN ASSESSMENT AND TOTAL MAXIMUM DAILY LOAD TRACKING AND IMPLEMENTATION SYSTEM (ATTAINS) PROGRAM TO SHARE WATERBODY ASSESSMENTS AND WORK TOWARDS REPLACING THE TRIBAL ASSESSMENT REPORT (TAR); CLEAN WATER ACT SECTION 401 CERTIFICATIONS TO IMPLEMENT THE TRIBE'S WATER QUALITY STANDARDS: STAFF TRAINING; COMMUNICATION WITH TRIBAL LEADERS AND TRIBAL RESIDENTS; RESEARCH MODELING PROGRAM TO QUANTIFY NUTRIENT AND SEDIMENT LOADING ON THE PUEBLO AND INCREASE THE DATA AVAILABLE TO ADDRESS SOURCES OF POLLUTION; FINALIZATION AND SUBMITTAL OF WATER QUALITY STANDARDS REVISION; DEVELOPMENT OF TRIBAL, COMMUNITY, STATE, AND FEDERAL PARTNERSHIPS TO ADDRESS ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES AT TAOS PUEBLO; INCLUSION OF WATER QUALITY ISSUES IN PUEBLO LONG-TERM AND ANNUAL PLANNING EFFORTS; DEVELOPMENT OF WATERSHED-BASED PLAN SPECIFIC TO TAOS PUEBLO AND THE RIO PUEBLO DE TAOS WITHIN TRIBAL BOUNDARIES; MULTI-YEAR NON-POINT SOURCE REDUCTION STRATEGY; DEVELOPMENT OF AN OVERARCHING STRATEGY TO PROTECT UNIMPAIRED WATERS AND IMPROVE IMPAIRED WATERS WHILE PROVIDING A FRAMEWORK FOR MEASURING PROGRESS; PHOTO-DOCUMENTATION OF PREVIOUS NON-POINT SOURCE (NPS) PROJECT CONDITIONS; REVISED AND UPDATED NPS MANAGEMENT PLAN.

THIS WILL ENHANCE THE BASELINE DATA SET FOR TRIBAL WATERBODIES, ENABLE THE ASSESSMENT OF SURFACE WATER CONDITIONS, AND ALLOW FOR THE IDENTIFICATION OF SURFACE WATERS WITH WATER QUALITY IMPAIRMENT(S). CONSERVE NATURAL RESOURCES AND LAND FILL SPACE WHILE REDUCING SOLID WASTE STREAM AND SAVING WASTE MANAGEMENT COST. REDUCED ILLEGAL DUMPING AND ASSIST TRIBAL GAS STATIONS WITH UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK COMPLIANCE ASSISTANCE AND FACILITY INSPECTIONS.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE SUBMITTING QUARTERLY FINAL AND TRIBAL ASSESSMENT REPORT (TAR) REPORTS ON PROGRAM ACTIVITIES AND ACCOMPLISHMENTS IN COMPLIANCE WITH COOPERATIVE AGREEMENTS. DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR THE OPERATION OF THE MUSCOGEE CREEK'S CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS WHILE GIVING IT GREATER FLEXIBILITY TO ADDRESS ITS HIGHEST ENVIRONMENTAL PRIORITIES, IMPROVE ENVIRONMENTAL PERFORMANCE, ACHIEVE SAVINGS AND STRENGTHEN THE PARTNERSHIP BETWEEN MUSCOGEE CREEK AND EPA. THIS AGREEMENT FUNDS TRIBAL CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS FOR AIR, WATER, LAND, AND DATA QUALITY; POLLUTION PREVENTION.ACTIVITIES:THE ANTICIPATED ACTIVITIES ARE TO IDENTIFY ILLEGAL DUMPING SITE AND REDUCE SOLID WASTE THROUGH WORKING WITH OKLAHOMA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY AND THE EPA TO CLEAN UP THESE SITES. COLLECT DATA AND IDENTIFY IMPAIRED BODIES OF WATER WHICH COULD POSE A HEALTH RISK FOR PLANTS, ANIMALS, AND PEOPLE. THE FOCUS IS ON THE WEWOKA/LITTLE WEWOKA WATERSHED LOCATED IN SOUTHEASTERN PORTION OF OUR JURISDICTION. THE WEWOKA CREEK IS IMPAIRED FOR TOTAL DISSOLVED SOLIDS, ENTEROCOCCUS, E.COLI, NITRATES, AND CHLORIDES. THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES FROM THIS AGREEMENT ARE LISTED ABOVE. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM ARE THE CITIZENS OF THE MUSCOGEE CREEK NATION.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES ARE QUARTERLY, SEMI ANNUAL AND FINAL PROGRESS REPORTS. TRIBAL ASSESSMENT REPORTS AND CLOSEOUT DOCUMENTS. QUALITY MANAGEMENT PLAN, AND GEOGRAPHIC INFORMATION SYSTEMS AND GLOBAL POSITIONING SYSTEMS, QUALITY ASSURANCE PROJECT PLAN. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARY IS THE MUSCOGEE CREEK NATION.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR THE OPERATION OF THE PUEBLO OF SANTA ANA'S CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS WHILE GIVING IT GREATER FLEXIBILITY TO ADDRESS ITS HIGHEST ENVIRONMENTAL PRIORITIES, IMPROVE ENVIRONMENTAL PERFORMANCE, ACHIEVE SAVINGS AND STRENGTHEN THE PARTNERSHIP BETWEEN PUEBLO OF SANTA ANA'S AND ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION 
AGENCY (EPA). THIS AGREEMENT FUNDS TRIBAL CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS FOR WATER-RELATED PROJECTS SUCH AS NONPOINT SOURCE IMPLEMENTATION AND SURFACE WATER QUALITY MONITORING PROJECTS.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE ASSESSING THE PUEBLO OF SANTA ANA'S STORM WATER DRAINAGES AND FLOW PATHS IN ORDER TO IDENTIFY BEST MANAGEMENT PRACTICES (BMPS), SAMPLING AND MONITORING SURFACE WATER QUALITY IN WATERBODIES WITHIN THE PUEBLO OF SANTA ANA, ASSESSING AND ANALYZING THE DATA COLLECTED, AND SUBMITTING THE DATA VIA WATER QUALITY EXCHANGE (WQX) DATABASE AND THE ASSESSMENT AND TOTAL MAXIMUM DAILY LOAD TRACKING AND IMPLEMENTATION SYSTEM (ATTAINS), AND A VARIETY OF EDUCATION/OUTREACH ACTIVITIES.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE DATA SUBMISSION THROUGH WATER QUALITY EXCHANGE (WQX), REPORTING THROUGH THE ASSESSMENT AND TOTAL MAXIMUM DAILY LOAD TRACKING AND IMPLEMENTATION SYSTEM (ATTAINS) PILOT AND THE DEVELOPMENT OF A CLEAN WATER ACT (CWA) SECTION 319(H) COMPETITIVE PROJECT PROPOSAL.

THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES FROM THIS AGREEMENT ARE AN IMPROVED UNDERSTANDING OF PUEBLO OF SANTA ANA'S SURFACE WATER QUALITY AND AN INCREASE IN COMMUNITY AWARENESS TO SURFACE WATER QUALITY ISSUES AND NONPOINT SOURCE POLLUTION.

DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM ARE THE CITIZENS OF THE PUEBLO OF SANTA ANA, HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR THE OPERATION OF THE LEECH LAKE BAND OF OJIBWE'S CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS WHILE GIVING IT GREATER FLEXIBILITY TO ADDRESS ITS HIGHEST ENVIRONMENTAL PRIORITIES, IMPROVE ENVIRONMENTAL PERFORMANCE, ACHIEVE ADMINISTRATIVE SAVINGS AND STRENGTHEN THE PARTNERSHIP BETWEEN THE LEECH LAKE BAND OF OJIBWE AND EPA. THIS AGREEMENT FUNDS TRIBAL PROGRAMS FOR ADMINISTERING AN AIR POLLUTION AND RADON CONTROL PROGRAM. THE LEECH LAKE BAND OF OJIBWE WILL CONTINUE ITS PROGRAM TO REDUCE EXPOSURE TO AMBIENT AIR POLLUTION AND RADON BY CONDUCTING AIR MONITORING AND TESTING OF RESIDENCES, ADVISING TRIBAL MEMBERS, AND ASSISTING IN FINDING MITIGATION FOR HOMES THAT MEET OR EXCEED THE U.S. EPA RADON ACTION LEVEL OF 4.0 PICOCURIES OF RADON PER LITER OF AIR (4.0 PCI/L). THE LEECH LAKE AIR PROGRAM WILL ALSO COORDINATE WITH THE TRIBAL HOUSING DEPARTMENT TO BUILD NEW HOMES ON THE RESERVATION THAT ARE RADON RESISTANT.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED UNDER THIS AGREEMENT INCLUDE AMBIENT AIR MONITORING FOR FINE PARTICULATE MATTER AND WET AND DRY MERCURY DEPOSITION WITH FULL METEOROLOGY, AND PARTNERSHIP WITH THE MINNESOTA POLLUTION CONTROL AGENCY'S PURPLE AIR NETWORK UTILIZING AIR QUALITY SENSORS.  THE TRIBE WILL ALSO UPDATE ITS EMISSIONS INVENTORY OF MAJOR AND MINOR AIR POLLUTION SOURCES IMPACTING THE LEECH LAKE RESERVATION, AND REVIEW AND COMMENT ON AIR OPERATING PERMITS FOR THESE FACILITIES.  LEECH LAKE WILL CONTINUE ITS LEADERSHIP ROLE IN LOCAL, REGIONAL, AND NATIONAL ORGANIZATIONS TO CREATE PARTNERSHIPS AND PROMOTE TRIBAL AIR QUALITY ISSUES AND AWARENESS.  THE TRIBE WILL PROMOTE ENERGY EFFICIENCY AND ALTERNATIVE ENERGY TO REDUCE GREENHOUSE GAS EMISSIONS ACROSS ITS RESERVATION LAND.  TRIBAL AIR STAFF WILL ALSO CONDUCT INDOOR AIR QUALITY INVESTIGATIONS AND PERFORM RADON TESTING TO REDUCE COMMUNITY MEMBER EXPOSURE TO RADON GAS AND OTHER AIR TOXICS IN THEIR HOMES.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE AN UPDATED MAJOR AND MINOR SOURCE EMISSIONS INVENTORY, QUALITY-ASSURED FINE PARTICULATE MATTER, MERCURY DEPOSITION, AND AIR QUALITY SENSOR DATA WITH FULL METEOROLOGICAL DATA, PROMOTION OF ENERGY EFFICIENCY ALTERNATIVE ENERGY, AND INDOOR AIR QUALITY ASSESSMENTS INCLUDING RADON TESTING OF TRIBAL RESIDENCES AND BUILDINGS.  THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES FROM THIS AGREEMENT ARE IMPROVED KNOWLEDGE OF AMBIENT AIR QUALITY CONDITIONS TO INFORM TRIBAL DECISION-MAKING, REDUCTIONS IN GREENHOUSE GAS EMISSIONS, AND REDUCED EXPOSURE TO AIR TOXICS AND RADON IN TRIBAL INDOOR ENVIRONMENTS.  DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM ARE THE CITIZENS OF THE LEECH LAKE BAND OF OJIBWE THAT WILL BENEFIT FROM THE GRANT.

DESCRIPTION:
THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $30,630 TO SUPPORT FLORIDA DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE AND CONSUMER SERVICES (FDACS), OFFICE OF AGRICULTURAL WATER POLICY (OAWP) IN THE STATE OF FLORIDA.  THIS AGENCY IS RESPONSIBLE FOR IMPLEMENTING REGULATORY PROGRAMS INTENDED TO RESULT IN INCREASING EFFICIENCIES IN AGRICULTURAL COMMODITY PRODUCTION AND REDUCED WATER QUALITY AND SUPPLY IMPACTS WITHIN IMPAIRED AND SENSITIVE WATER RESOURCE AREAS.  THE PROJECT WILL BE USED TO IDENTIFY AND QUANTIFY ADDITIONAL BENEFITS AND ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES GENERATED FROM FDACS OAWP NUTRIENT, IRRIGATION AND WATER RESOURCE MANAGEMENT BEST MANAGEMENT PRACTICES (BMPS) THAT ARE ABOVE AND BEYOND ESTABLISHED FOUNDATIONAL BASELINES OF EFFICIENCIES RESULTING FROM THE PROPER IMPLEMENTATION OF BMPS UNDER FLORIDA LAW.  


ACTIVITIES:
ACTIVITIES INCLUDE:
1)	REVIEW EXISTING STATE LAW GOVERNING BMP AND BASIN MANAGEMENT ACTION PLAN (BMAP) IMPLEMENTATION, AND THE REGULATORY BMP BASELINES FOR AGRICULTURAL PRODUCERS ACROSS ADOPTED BMP MANUALS
2)	REVIEW ESTABLISHED BMAPS AND ANTICIPATED REDUCTIONS TIED TO BMP IMPLEMENTATION AND ASSOCIATED COST SHARE PROJECTS
3)	REVIEW EXISTING COST SHARE, PUBLIC GOODS, AND PAYMENT FOR ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES PROGRAMS THAT HAVE BEEN IMPLEMENTED AT THE STATE AND FEDERAL LEVEL TO IDENTIFY STRENGTHS AND AREAS FOR EXPANSION AND IMPROVEMENT
4)	IDENTIFY MULTI-FACETED PRACTICES AND PROJECTS THAT CAN RESULT IN ADDITIONALLY WATER RESOURCE AND CLIMATE RESILIENCY GAINS ACROSS THE PRODUCTION LANDSCAPE 
5)	DEVELOP METHODOLOGIES AND/OR MODELS TO QUANTIFY ANTICIPATED ENVIRONMENTAL RESOURCE BENEFITS AND PROPOSE VALUATIONS FOR THESE ACTIVITIES WHERE APPLICABLE BMPS ARE ALREADY BEING PROPERLY IMPLEMENTED AND WHERE THE NEED EXISTS FOR ADDITIONAL RESOURCE GAINS TO MEET ESTABLISHED BMAP GOALS
6)	PREPARE REPORTS AND SUPPORTING METHODOLOGICAL DOCUMENTS AND TECHNICAL TOOLS RECOMMENDING ANY NECESSARY AMENDMENTS TO STATE LAW AND EXISTING REGULATIONS TO ENHANCE EXISTING PUBLIC GOODS AND ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES FRAMEWORKS TO PROVIDE FDACS THE ABILITY TO FUND AND IMPLEMENT PRACTICES AND PROJECTS PROVIDING PUBLIC GOODS AND/OR ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES BEYOND THOSE REQUIRED UNDER EXISTING BMP AND BMAP REGULATORY FRAMEWORKS.
OUTCOMES:
PROJECT OUTCOMES WILL BE USED TO HELP DEVELOP A REGULATORY AND/OR STATUTORY COST SHARE FRAMEWORK FOR THE PAYMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES THAT ARE ABOVE AND BEYOND THE APPLICABLE BMPS THAT AGRICULTURAL PRODUCERS MUST IMPLEMENT UNDER FLORIDA LAW TO ESTABLISH AND MAINTAIN A PRESUMPTION OF COMPLIANCE WITH STATE WATER QUALITY STANDARDS. THIS FRAMEWORK WILL PROVIDE EXPANDED INCENTIVE-BASED PROGRAMS TO ACHIEVE LOAD ALLOCATIONS UNDER ESTABLISHED TOTAL MAXIMUM DAILY LOADS AND ASSOCIATED BASIN MANAGEMENT ACTION PLANS.

DELIVERABLES: SUMMARY REPORT OF EXISTING REQUIREMENTS AND IDENTIFICATION OF ADDITIONAL PRACTICES AND PROJECTS FOR IMPLEMENTATION AND FINAL REPORT.  THE CITIZENS OF THE STATE OF FLORIDA ARE DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM.
SUBRECIPIENT:
NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.

THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $30,463 TO THE FLORIDA DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH TO SUPPORT THEIR EFFORTS WITH PROTECTING THE PUBLIC FROM ENVIRONMENTAL HAZARDS AND TOXIC EXPOSURES, SUPPORTING ENVIRONMENTAL PUBLIC HEALTH PRACTICE, EDUCATING COMMUNITY PARTNERS AND POLICY MAKERS ABOUT ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH RISKS AND PROTECTIVE MEASURES, AND INCREASING RISK COMMUNICATION PERFORMANCE. EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE IDENTIFYING PREPAREDNESS NEEDS FOR EMERGING TOXIN THREATS WITH A FOCUS ON DRINKING WATER AND RECREATIONAL SURFACE WATER, AND TO DEVELOP, CONDUCT AND ANALYZE TABLETOP EXERCISES ON THESE ISSUES TO RESPOND TO FUTURE EVENTS MORE EFFECTIVELY. THE FLORIDA DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH IS EXPECTED TO PROVIDE A SUB-AWARD TO AN INSTITUTION OF HIGHER EDUCATION FROM WITHIN THE STATE UNIVERSITY SYSTEM. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES ARE THE STATE OF FLORIDA CITIZENS.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR THE OPERATION OF THE WASHINGTON STATE DEPARTMENT OF COMMERCE'S CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS WHILE GIVING IT GREATER FLEXIBILITY TO ADDRESS ITS HIGHEST ENVIRONMENTAL PRIORITIES, IMPROVE ENVIRONMENTAL PERFORMANCE, ACHIEVE ADMINISTRATIVE SAVINGS AND STRENGTHEN THE PARTNERSHIP BETWEEN WASHINGTON STATE DEPARTMENT OF COMMERCE AND EPA.ACTIVITIES:SECTION 404(G) OF TSCA AUTHORIZES EPA TO MAKE GRANTS TO STATES AND TRIBES TO UNDERTAKE COMPLIANCE AND ENFORCEMENT ACTIVITIES WHERE THERE ARE APPROVED STATE OR TRIBAL PROGRAMS TO ADMINISTER AND ENFORCE STANDARDS AND REGULATIONS PERTAINING TO LEAD EXPOSURE REDUCTION.  SPECIFICALLY, TSCA SECTION 402 PERTAINS TO LEAD-BASED PAINT ACTIVITIES (INCLUDING ABATEMENT AND RENOVATION), TRAINING AND CERTIFICATION AND SCA SECTION 406 PERTAINS TO PRE-RENOVATION EDUCATION, INCLUDING THE DISSEMINATION OF A LEAD HAZARD INFORMATION PAMPHLET.  UNLIKE TSCA SECTION 28(A), THERE IS NO STATE MATCHING REQUIREMENT. DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR THE OPERATION OF THE LAC DU FLAMBEAU BAND OF LAKE SUPERIOR CHIPPEWA INDIANS (LDF) CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS WHILE GIVING IT GREATER FLEXIBILITY TO ADDRESS ITS HIGHEST ENVIRONMENTAL PRIORITIES, IMPROVE ENVIRONMENTAL PERFORMANCE, ACHIEVE ADMINISTRATIVE SAVINGS, AND STRENGTHEN THE PARTNERSHIP BETWEEN LDF AND EPA. THIS AGREEMENT FUNDS TRIBAL PROGRAMS TO CARRY OUT CLEAN WATER ACT SECTION 106, CLEAN WATER ACT SECTION 319, AND GENERAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAM ACTIVITIES. THE WORK INCLUDES OUTPUTS AND OUTCOMES ASSOCIATED WITH MANAGING CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS WHICH INCLUDE ACTIVITIES TO PROTECT AND MAINTAIN ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM CAPACITY BUILDING AND WATER QUALITY. THE DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS AGREEMENT ARE THE CITIZENS OF THE LAC DU FLAMBEAU BAND OF LAKE SUPERIOR CHIPPEWA INDIANS. ACTIVITIES:SPECIFICALLY, LDF WILL PROTECT THE QUALITY OF THE TRIBE'S WATER, LAND, AND AIR RESOURCES BY BUILDING AND ENHANCING THE BASIC INFRASTRUCTURE OF AN ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM AND MAINTAIN ADEQUATE MEASURES FOR THE PREVENTION AND CONTROL OF SURFACE AND GROUNDWATER POLLUTION FROM BOTH POINT AND NON-POINT SOURCES.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE WORK INCLUDES OUTPUTS AND OUTCOMES ASSOCIATED WITH MANAGING CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS WHICH INCLUDE DELIVERABLES TO PROTECT AND MAINTAIN ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM CAPACITY BUILDING AND WATER QUALITY. LDF'S GOAL IS TO BUILD AND SUSTAIN ENVIRONMENTAL RESOURCE PROTECTION FOR THE LAC DU FLAMBEAU BAND OF LAKE SUPERIOR CHIPPEWA BY COORDINATING WITH VARIOUS PROGRAMS AND ENTITIES THAT CARRY FORTH THOSE RESPONSIBILITIES FOR FUTURE GENERATIONS. THE DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS AGREEMENT ARE THE CITIZENS OF THE LAC DU FLAMBEAU BAND OF LAKE SUPERIOR CHIPPEWA.

THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR THE OPERATION OF THE INDIANA STATE DEPARTMENT OF HEALTHS (IDOH) CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS WHILE GIVING IT GREATER FLEXIBILITY TO ADDRESS ITS HIGHEST ENVIRONMENTAL PRIORITIES, IMPROVE ENVIRONMENTAL  PERFORMANCE, ACHIEVE ADMINISTRATIVE SAVINGS AND STRENGTHEN THE PARTNERSHIP BETWEEN THE INDIANA STATE DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND EPA.  THE WORK INCLUDES OUTPUTS AND OUTCOMES ASSOCIATED WITH MANAGING CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS WHICH INCLUDE ACTIVITIES TO PROTECT AND MAINTAIN LEAD AND ENFORCEMENT ACTIVITIES.  SOME OF THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED ARE:
IDOH ANTICIPATES CONTINUING INCREASES IN ANNUAL ABATEMENT PROJECT TOTALS, PARTIALLY DUE TO THE RESUMPTION AND FURTHER DEVELOPMENT OF LEAD ADVISORY PANEL EFFORTS IN EDUCATION AND OUTREACH.  ADDITIONALLY, CHIP FUNDING WILL CONTINUE THROUGH 2022.  IDOH WILL CONTINUE TO MONITOR TRENDS THAT IMPACT THE ABATEMENT PROGRAM AND COMMUNICATE ANY SUCH CHANGES TO THE EPA.  
IDOH HAS AND WILL CONTINUE TO ADVOCATE FOR STATE ADOPTION OF THE RPR PROGRAM AND WILL PURSUE ADDING THIS AUTHORITY DURING FUTURE LEGISLATIVE BUDGET YEARS.
IDOH ANTICIPATES A 100% RENEWAL RATE ON TRAINING COURSE PROVIDER LICENSES.
IDOH WILL PERFORM AN ANNUAL AUDIT IN EACH OF THE 5 LEAD DISCIPLINES (RISK ASSESSOR, INSPECTOR, SUPERVISOR, WORKER, CLEARANCE EXAMINER) FOR EACH OF INDIANA&RSQUOANDS 4 ACTIVE TRAINING COURSE PROVIDERS.

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR THE OPERATION OF THE WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH SERVICES CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS WHILE GIVING IT GREATER FLEXIBILITY TO ADDRESS ITS HIGHEST ENVIRONMENTAL PRIORITIES, IMPROVE ENVIRONMENTAL  PERFORMANCE, ACHIEVE ADMINISTRATIVE SAVINGS AND STRENGTHEN THE PARTNERSHIP BETWEEN THE WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH SERVICES AND EPA. THIS AGREEMENT FUNDS STATEWIDE PROGRAMS TO LEAD-BASED PAINT ACTIVITIES (TSCA SECTION 404(G)) AND TOXIC SUBSTANCES COMPLIANCE MONITORING (TSCA SECTION 404G).  THE WORK INCLUDES OUTPUTS AND OUTCOMES ASSOCIATED WITH MANAGING CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS, WHICH INCLUDE ACTIVITIES TO PROTECT AND MAINTAIN LEAD AND ENFORCEMENT ACTIVITIES.  ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE: DEVELOPING A NEW SYSTEM OF EXAM PROCTORING/ADMINISTRATION TO RESEARCH THE POSSIBILITY OF USING LOCAL JOB CENTERS MANAGED BY THE WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT TO EASE THE NEED FOR IN-PERSON PROCTORING, REDUCE TRAVEL FOR EXAM REGISTRANTS, AND GENERALLY IMPROVE CONVENIENCEAND INVESTIGATE 100% OF REGULATED RENO COMPLAINTS RECEIVEDAND PUBLISH ENFORCEMENT CASES FOR LEAD AND RENOVATION ENFORCEMENTS ON ITS WEBSITEAND SEND CERTIFICATION RENEWAL AND EXPIRATION NOTICES TO CONTRACTORS AND BEGIN SENDING THESE ELECTRONICALLYAND AND PROCESS 90% WITHIN THE REGULATORY TIMEFRAME OF 15 DAYS OF RECEIPT OF VIABLE APPLICATION. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM ARE THE CITIZENS OF WISCONSIN.

MAINTAINING A MINIMUM OF 1000 ACTIVE INDIVIDUAL CERTIFICATIONS  DURING EACH FISCAL YEAR OF THE AWARD.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE STOCKBRIDGE-MUNSEE BAND OF MOHICAN INDIANS TO CARRY OUT A PERFORMANCE PARTNERSHIP GRANT (PPG) OF CLEAN WATER ACT (CWA) SECTION 106 AND 319 PROGRAMS. THROUGH FUNDING FOR THE CWA 106 PROGRAM, STOCKBRIDGE-MUNSEE WILL COLLECT AND ASSESS WATER QUALITY DATA AND PLAN/ IMPLEMENT MANAGEMENT STRATEGIES FOR THE PROTECTION OF TRIBAL WATERS. THROUGH FUNDING FOR THE CWA 319 PROGRAM, THE TRIBE WILL REDUCE NON-POINT SOURCES OF POLLUTION IN TRIBAL AND NEXUS WATERS, IMPROVING PRESENT AND FUTURE WATER QUALITY.ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE BASELINE WATER QUALITY MONITORING, HABITAT ASSESSMENT AND BIOLOGICAL MONITORING, PROVIDING TECHNICAL SUPPORT, OUTREACH AND EDUCATION TO TRIBAL DEPARTMENTS AND COMMUNITY MEMBERS, DELINEATING WETLANDS AND RIVER/STREAM BUFFERS, COMPLETING A RAIN GARDEN PROJECT AND SECOND LAKE ACCESS IMPROVEMENT, IMPLEMENTING USE OF CHLORIDE FREE DEICING PRODUCTS, AND USING LIDAR TO CREATE A HYDROLOGIC MODEL OF TRIBAL LANDS, CULVERT INVENTORY AND ARCGIS STREAM LAYER. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:DELIVERABLES WILL INCLUDE WATER QUALITY ASSESSMENT REPORTS, DATA ENTERED INTO WQX, SEMI-ANNUAL REPORTS, A QUALITY ASSURANCE PROJECT PLAN, A MONITORING STRATEGY, WETLAND DELINEATIONS, RIVER BUFFER INSTALLATIONS, POST HARVEST EVALUATIONS, COMPLETED RAIN GARDEN, LAKE ACCESS, ROAD REPAIRS, AN ARCGIS HYDROLOGICAL MODEL AND STREAM ORDER LAYER, MEDIA ARTICLES AND INFORMATIONAL SIGNAGE AT PROJECTS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE MAINTENANCE AND PROTECTION OF TRIBAL SURFACE WATER RESOURCES, INCREASED COMMUNITY AWARENESS OF TRIBAL WATER RESOURCES, AND REDUCTION OF NONPOINT SOURCE POLLUTION. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARY IS THE STOCKBRIDGE-MUNSEE COMMUNITY.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS AGREEMENT IS TO SUPPORT THE INTER TRIBAL COUNCIL OF ARIZONA (ITCA) IN ENSURING THAT PESTICIDES ARE MANUFACTURED, SOLD, USED, AND STORED ACCORDING TO FEDERAL AND THE TRIBES' ORDINANCES/LAW. THE WORK INCLUDES OUTPUTS AND OUTCOMES ASSOCIATED WITH SUPPORTING MEMBER TRIBES IN MANAGING CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS WHICH INCLUDE ACTIVITIES TO INCREASE AND MAINTAIN THE UNDERSTANDING AND COMPLIANCE WITH PESTICIDE LAWS AND REGULATIONS, PROTECTING HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT BY IMPLEMENTING ACTIVITIES RELATED TO COMPLIANCE, CERTIFICATION AND TRAINING, AND PESTICIDE PROGRAM ACTIVITIES RELATED TO ENDANGERED SPECIES, WATER QUALITY AND WORKER SAFETY. THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES PARTIAL FEDERAL FUNDING FOR THE FIRST YEAR OF AGREEMENT FY23 AT $129,534. ITCA HAS SUBMITTED AN APPLICATION FOR A FOUR YEAR PPG THAT INCLUDES PROPOSED SPECIAL PROJECTS IN YEAR TWO AND THREE, FOR A COMBINED TOTAL FEDERAL FUNDING REQUEST OF $658,136.ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES INCLUDE MONITORING OF COMPLIANCE WITH PESTICIDE LAWS AND REGULATION AND OUTREACH/EDUCATION TO PESTICIDE APPLICATORS, AGRICULTURAL WORKERS AND ESTABLISHMENT WHERE PESTICIDES ARE USED. RECIPIENT WILL MONITOR APPLICATORS WHO USE RESTRICTED USE PESTICIDES OUTREACH AND EDUCATION REGARDING PESTICIDES WILL ALSO INCLUDE FARM COMMUNITIES WHERE THERE MAY BE A HIGH LEVEL OF PESTICIDE USE. GRANTEE WILL MAINTAIN ADEQUATE PESTICIDE LAWS AND REGULATIONS AND ASSOCIATED IMPLEMENTATION. ITCA ALSO COMMITS TO OBTAINING AND MAINTAINING FEDERAL CREDENTIALS SO AS TO SERVE OTHER PARTICIPATING TRIBES WITH INSPECTIONS IN SUPPORT OF OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS AGREEMENT IS TO SUPPORT THE QUECHAN INDIAN COMMUNITY IN ENSURING THAT PESTICIDES ARE MANUFACTURED, SOLD, USED, AND STORED ACCORDING TO FEDERAL AND THE TRIBE'S ORDINANCES/LAW. THE WORK INCLUDES OUTPUTS AND OUTCOMES ASSOCIATED WITH MANAGING CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS WHICH INCLUDE ACTIVITIES TO INCREASE AND MAINTAIN THE UNDERSTANDING AND COMPLIANCE WITH PESTICIDE LAWS AND REGULATIONS, PROTECTING HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT BY IMPLEMENTING ACTIVITIES RELATED TO COMPLIANCE, CERTIFICATION AND TRAINING, AND PESTICIDE PROGRAM ACTIVITIES RELATED TO ENDANGERED SPECIES, WATER QUALITY AND WORKER SAFETY. FUNDING INCLUDES $1,500 FOR A SUPPLEMENTAL PROJECT IN SUPPORT OF WORKER OUTREACH.  SALT RIVER HAS ALSO APPLIED FOR SUPPLEMENTAL FUNDING FOR TWO PROJECTS WHICH COMBINED TOTAL $35,300 FOR FY23.  THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $35,300. ACTIVITIES:
ACTIVITIES INCLUDE MONITORING OF COMPLIANCE WITH PESTICIDE LAWS AND REGULATION AND OUTREACH/EDUCATION TO PESTICIDE APPLICATORS, AGRICULTURAL WORKERS AND ESTABLISHMENT WHERE PESTICIDES ARE USED. RECIPIENT WILL MONITOR APPLICATORS WHO USE RESTRICTED USE PESTICIDES. OUTREACH AND EDUCATION REGARDING PESTICIDES WILL ALSO INCLUDE FARM COMMUNITIES WHERE THERE MAY BE A HIGH LEVEL OF PESTICIDE USE. GRANTEE WILL MAINTAIN ADEQUATE PESTICIDE LAWS AND REGULATIONS AND ASSOCIATED IMPLEMENTATION.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:DELIVERABLES AND OUTCOMES INCLUDE BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO REPORTING OF INSPECTION NUMBERS AND ENFORCEMENT ACCOMPLISHMENTS INCLUDING NOTIFICATION AND FOLLOW-UP ON SIGNIFICANT PESTICIDE INCIDENCE. NEGOTIATED INSPECTIONS WILL BE MADE AVAILABLE FOR REVIEW. GRANTEE WILL MONITOR PESTICIDE APPLICATIONS AND CONDUCT TRAINING AND OUTREACH TO PROMOTE WORKER SAFETY AND COMMUNITY.  WORKING WITH LOCAL AND REGIONAL FISH AND WILDLIFE AGENCIES, GRANTEE WILL PROVIDE OUTREACH TRAINING MATERIALS ON POLLINATORS AND ENDANGERED SPECIES TO PESTICIDE APPLICATORS AT VARIOUS FORUMS. BEE KILLS WILL BE REPORTED TO EPA.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR THE OPERATION OF THE STATE OF ALASKA'S CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS WHILE GIVING IT GREATER FLEXIBILITY TO ADDRESS ITS HIGHEST ENVIRONMENTAL PRIORITIES, IMPROVE ENVIRONMENTAL PERFORMANCE, ACHIEVE ADMINISTRATIVE SAVINGS AND STRENGTHEN THE PARTNERSHIP BETWEEN THE STATE AND EPA. THIS AGREEMENT FUNDS STATE CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS FOR WATER POLLUTION CONTROL, WATER QUALITY MONITORING, AND NONPOINT SOURCE MANAGEMENT PROGRAMS.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED WILL SUPPORT ONGOING WATER QUALITY STANDARDS, WATER QUALITY ASSESSMENT, WATERBODY RESTORATION AND PROTECTION, CLEAN WATER PROGRAM, AND COMPLIANCE AND ENFORCEMENT EFFORTS. SUBRECIPIENT:SUBAWARDS WILL BE MADE TO CONDUCT WATER QUALITY MONITORING PROJECTS, WHICH AUGMENTS STATE OF ALASKA RESOURCES AND EXPANDS MONITORING, ASSESSMENT, RESTORATION, PROTECTION, AND EDUCATION ON ALASKA CLEAN WATER ACTIONS (AWCA) PRIORITIES. OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE MID-YEAR, AND END-OF-YEAR STATUS UPDATES ON FUNDED INITIATIVES; ANNUAL REPORT TO THE BOARD OF FORESTRY, WATER QUALITY DATA ENTERED INTO THE EPA WATER QUALITY PORTAL; CURRENT AND ACCURATE WEB PAGES; FIELD AND LAB DATA COLLECTIONS REVIEWED FOR QUALITY ASSURANCE; WATERBODY SUCCESS STORIES; NONPOINT SOURCE STRATEGY STATUS REPORT; ONSITE WASTEWATER SYSTEM INSTALLER TRAINING AND CERTIFICATION; QUARTERLY UPDATES AT ALASKA/EPA MEETINGS; AND DOCUMENTATION OF ENFORCEMENT ACTIONS.

THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES FROM THIS AGREEMENT INCLUDE PROTECTING PUBLIC HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT THROUGH EFFECTIVE STATE PERMITTING; RESOURCES ARE SPENT ON THE HIGHEST PRIORITY PROGRAMS AND WATERBODIES; STATE AND FEDERAL AGENCY STAFF, STAKEHOLDERS, AND THE PUBLIC HAVE ACCURATE DATA TO MAKE INFORMED DECISION; SAMPLING PROJECTS PRODUCE TECHNICALLY SOUND DATA; ALASKA'S WATERS ARE MAKING PROGRESS TOWARD MEETING WATER QUALITY STANDARDS AND ARE CAPABLE OF SUPPORTING ALL DESIGNATED USES; THE PUBLIC AND STAKEHOLDERS UNDERSTAND THEIR ROLE IN PREVENTION OF NONPOINT SOURCE POLLUTION AND WORK IN PARTNERSHIP WITH THE STATE; CONSTRUCTION PROJECTS CAUSE MINIMAL SHORT-TERM AND NO LONG-TERM ADVERSE WATER QUALITY IMPACTS AND PERMANENT FACILITIES' RUNOFF DOES NOT CAUSE WATER QUALITY IMPAIRMENT; AND TIMELY AND APPROPRIATE ENFORCEMENT ACTION.

DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM ARE THE CITIZENS OF AND VISITORS TO THE STATE OF ALASKA.

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR THE OPERATION OF THE CHEHALIS INDIAN TRIBE'S CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS WHILE GIVING IT GREATER FLEXIBILITY TO IMPROVE ENVIRONMENTAL PERFORMANCE, ACHIEVE ADMINISTRATIVE SAVINGS AND STRENGTHEN THE PARTNERSHIP BETWEEN THE TRIBE AND EPA. THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDS TO BUILD ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS. THE WORK INCLUDES OUTPUTS AND OUTCOMES ASSOCIATED WITH MANAGING CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS AND ACTIVITIES TO PROTECT AND MAINTAIN WATER, LAND AND DATA QUALITY. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS GRANT ARE MEMBERS OF THE TRIBE.

THIS PROJECT WILL BUILD TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL CAPACITY THROUGH PARTICIPATION IN INTERGOVERNMENTAL PROCESSES (SUCH AS THE CHEHALIS BASIN PARTNERSHIP), DESIGNING IMPROVEMENTS TO THE TRIBE'S SOLID WASTE CONVENIENCE STATION, MANAGING THE EXISTING RECYCLING PROGRAM, AND ASSESSING POTENTIAL EXPANSION OF THE PROGRAM. ADDITIONALLY, THE TRIBE WILL MONITOR SURFACE AND GROUNDWATER SITES, COMPLETE A WATER QUALITY TRIBAL ASSESSMENT REPORT, SUBMIT DATA INTO THE STORAGE AND RETRIEVAL (STORET) DATA WAREHOUSE, AND UPDATE THE WATER QUALITY MONITORING STRATEGY.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR THE OPERATION OF THE LEECH LAKE BAND OF OJIBWE'S CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS FOR THE CLEAN WATER ACT (CWA 106 AND CWA 319) WHILE GIVING IT GREATER FLEXIBILITY TO ADDRESS ITS HIGHEST ENVIRONMENTAL PRIORITIES, IMPROVE ENVIRONMENTAL PERFORMANCE, ACHIEVE ADMINISTRATIVE SAVINGS AND STRENGTHEN THE PARTNERSHIP BETWEEN LEECH LAKE AND EPA. THIS AGREEMENT FUNDS A TRIBAL PROGRAM FOR CLEAN WATER ACT SECTION 319 PROGRAM AS WELL AS A CLEAN WATER ACT SECTION 106 PROGRAM. THE WORK INCLUDES OUTPUTS AND OUTCOMES ASSOCIATED WITH MANAGING CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS WHICH INCLUDE ACTIVITIES TO PROTECT AND MAINTAIN THE TRIBE'S ADMINISTRATIVE OVERSIGHT OF THEIR ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS AND CONTRIBUTE TO THE RESTORATION OF WETLANDS AND PRIORITY RIPARIAN HABITATS ON RESERVATION LANDS.

THE DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS AGREEMENT ARE THE CITIZENS OF THE LEECH LAKE BAND OF OJIBWE.
ACTIVITIES:SPECIFICALLY THESE PROJECTS WILL ENSURE THAT THE LEECH LAKE BAND OF OJIBWE IS ABLE TO SUCCESSFULLY RUN ITS CLEAN WATER ACT (CWA) 106 PROGRAM BY CONTINUOUSLY MONITORING WATERS ON RESERVATION, ATTENDING APPROPRIATE MEETINGS AND CONFERENCES, CONDUCTING EDUCATION AND OUTREACH, UPDATING ITS PROGRAMMATIC DOCUMENTS, FINALIZE THEIR FEDERALLY-APPROVED WATER QUALITY STANDARDS PACKAGE, COMPLETE CWA 401 CERTIFICATIONS OF PERMITS, AND CONDUCT OTHER ADMINISTRATIVE TASKS ASSOCIATED WITH RUNNING THE 106 PROGRAM. ADDITIONALLY THIS GRANT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING FOR LEECH LAKE TO RUN A SUCCESSFUL CWA 319 PROGRAM THAT WILL INCLUDE TAKING INVENTORY OF AREAS WITH SENSITIVE WETLANDS AND RIPARIAN HABITATS IN PROXIMITY TO PRIVATELY MANAGED FOREST LANDS AS WELL AS INVENTORY ROAD CONDITIONS WITH IN FORESTED HABITATS THAT ARE PRONE TO EROSION NEAR WETLAND/RIPARIAN CROSSINGS, ATTEND APPROPRIATE MEETINGS AND CONFERENCES, COMPLETE AN INTEGRATED FOREST RESOURCE MANAGEMENT PLAN, FINALIZE AN UPDATED WETLAND PROGRAM PLAN, DEVELOPMENT AND IMPLEMENT AN ANNUAL MONITORING PROGRAM FOR CHLORIDES AND HERBICIDES, IMPLEMENT A PESTICIDE MANAGEMENT PROGRAM, COORDINATE GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE PRACTICES WITH OTHER GOVERNMENTAL ENTITIES, INVENTORY FAILING OR NON-COMPLIANT SEPTIC SYSTEMS AND IDENTIFY SHORELAND AREAS IMPACTED BY DEVELOPMENTAL PRESSURES.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:FOR CWA 106, THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES OF THIS PROJECT INCLUDE:
-	ENSURES THE SUCCESSFUL OPERATION AND CONTINUANCE OF THE TRIBE'S SURFACE WATER QUALITY MONITORING PROJECT, WATER QUALITY STANDARDS, AND OTHER PROJECTS
-	KNOWLEDGEABLE AND BETTER TRAINED AND INFORMED WATER RESOURCES PROGRAM STAFF
-	INCREASE IN KNOWLEDGE OF THE PROGRAM BY THE COMMUNITY AND HELP THE COMMUNITY BECOME INVOLVED IN THE IMPROVEMENT OF WATER QUALITY ON THE RESERVATION
-	STANDARDIZATION OF DATA COLLECTION METHODS ACROSS ALL SITES TO ENSURE QUALITY ASSURANCE AND CONTROL
-	DATA WILL PROVIDE KNOWLEDGE OF STATUS OF THE TRIBE'S AQUATIC RESOURCES. INFORMATION WILL LEAD TO BETTER MANAGEMENT OF AQUATIC RESOURCES AS WELL AS ASSESSING WHETHER RESERVATION WATERBODIES ARE MEETING TRIBAL WATER QUALITY STANDARDS
-	COMPLETION OF WATER QUALITY STANDARDS WILL ALLOW LEECH LAKE TO PROTECT TRIBAL RESOURCES THROUGH THE ENFORCEMENT OF THE CWA 401 PROGRAM
-	ENSURE THAT AQUATIC RESOURCES ARE PROTECTED WHEN PUBLIC WATER WORK PERMITS ARE BEING ISSUED BY THE STATE OF MINNESOTA.
-	ASSURING THE BAND HAS AN ENVIRONMENTAL PRESENCE LOCALLY, STATEWIDE AND REGIONALLY.
-	ASSURE ALL INDIVIDUAL SEPTIC TREATMENT SYSTEMS ARE IN COMPLIANCE WITH LEECH LAKE STANDARDS TO PROTECT THE GROUND AND SURFACE WATER RESOURCES OF THE BAND
-	ENSURING THE HEALTH OF BEACH USERS
-	BY ACTIVE PARTICIPATION IN MEETINGS AND COMMENTING ON PROJECT PROPOSALS AND ACTIVITIES, LEECH LAKE STAFF WILL BE PROTECTING RESERVATION WATERS AND PROVIDING TRIBAL REPRESENTATION.
FOR CWA 319, THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES OF THIS PROJECT INCLUDE:

THE LEECH LAKE BAND OF OJIBWE (LEECH LAKE BAND) WILL ADMINISTER AN AIR POLLUTION AND RADON CONTROL PROGRAMS. SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES INCLUDE MERCURY DEPOSITION STUDIES, COLLECTING METEOROLOGICAL DATA, AND ENGAGING IN THE PERMITS PROCESS. IN ADDITION, LEECH LAKE BAND WILL CONTINUE DEVELOPING ITS EMISSIONS INVENTORY, INCLUDING MINOR SOURCES PER THE U.S. ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY'S TRIBAL MINOR NEW SOURCE REVIEW RULE, AND CONTINUE TO ENFORCE ITS OPEN BURNING, BURN BARREL, AND FIRE PREVENTION ORDINANCE.    LEECH LAKE BAND WILL ALSO PROMOTE TRIBAL AIR QUALITY ISSUES WITH LOCAL, REGIONAL, AND NATIONAL ORGANIZATIONS, AND PROVIDE LEADERSHIP ON AIR QUALITY ISSUES TO THE LEECH LAKE TRIBAL COMMUNITY.  LEECH LAKE BAND WILL CONTINUE ITS PROGRAM TO REDUCE EXPOSURE TO RADON BY CONDUCTING TESTING OF RESIDENCES, ADVISING TRIBAL MEMBERS, AND ASSISTING IN FINDING MITIGATION FOR HOMES THAT MEET OR EXCEED THE U.S. EPA RADON ACTION LEVEL OF 4.0 PICOCURIES OF RADON PER LITER OF AIR (4.0 PCI/L). DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $1,523,153 TO MISSISSIPPI DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY FOR THEIR CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS. THIS AGREEMENT FUNDS THE FOLLOWING PROGRAMS FOR AIR, WATER, LAND, ENFORCEMENT AND PERMITTING, DATA QUALITY MANAGEMENT, COMPLIANCE MONITORING, AND GRANT MANAGEMENT.ACTIVITIES:THE MULTI-MEDIA PERFORMANCE PARTNERSHIP GRANT AGREEMENT INCLUDES HAZARDOUS WASTE MANAGEMENT (SOLID WASTE DISPOSAL ACT, SECTION 3011(A)), WATER POLLUTION CONTROL (CWA 106), AND CLEAN AIR ACT, SECTION 105 CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS THAT ENCOMPASS A VARIETY OF GRANT ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED AS OUTLINED IN APPROVED WORK PLANS. IN SUMMARY, ACTIVITIES INCLUDE BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO MONITORING, INSPECTIONS, PERMITTING, AND ENFORCEMENT AND COMPLIANCE; ASSESSMENTS OF PUBLIC WATER SUPPLIES AND WATER QUALITY DATA; AMBIENT AIR MONITORING; CONTROL MITIGATION OF CONTAMINATED AREAS; IMPLEMENTATION STANDARDS, PLANS, STRATEGIES, AND ACTIONS TO PRESERVE ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY; DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT ACTIVITIES RELATED TO EMERGING CONTAMINANTS; AND PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO GOVERNMENT AND THE PRIVATE SECTOR TO REDUCE POLLUTION, ALL IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE MULTI-MEDIA PERFORMANCE PARTNERSHIP GRANT WORK PLANS AND STATUTORY REQUIREMENTS.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES FOR THE CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS IN THE MULTI-MEDIA PERFORMANCE PARTNERSHIP GRANT AGREEMENT INCLUDE BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO (1) END-OF-YEAR (EOY) REPORT(S) SUMMARIZING METRIC ACHIEVEMENTS AND CHALLENGES, WHERE APPLICABLE TO INCLUDE MECHANISMS FOR MONITORING IMPROVED WATER QUALITY. (2) MECHANISMS TAKEN TO IDENTIFY, PREVENT, AND ABATE SOURCES OF CONTAMINATION/ POLLUTION. (3) CORRECTIVE ACTION COMPLIANCE EVALUATIONS, GROUNDWATER MONITORING EVALUATIONS, AND /OR OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE INSPECTIONS AT NON-OPERATING TREATMENT, STORAGE, AND DISPOSAL FACILITIES. (4) COMPLETED SANITARY SURVEYS FOR THE CURRENT YEAR IN SDWIS. (5) MILESTONE REPORT ON PROGRESS TOWARD ADOPTION OF WATER QUALITY STANDARDS FOR TOTAL NITROGEN AND TOTAL PHOSPHORUS FOR EACH WATER BODY TYPE. (6) PERMITTING AND CORRECTIVE ACTION COMPLIANCE ACHIEVEMENTS. (7) QUARTERLY REPORTS OR UPDATES ON ACTIVITIES AND ACCOMPLISHMENTS REGARDING PM2.5, OZONE, LEAD, AND OTHER NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARDS AS WELL AS AMBIENT AIR MONITORING. EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE PROTECTION AND RESTORATION OF WATERBODIES AND WATERSHEDS, IMPROVED COMPLIANCE WITH FEDERAL ENVIRONMENTAL LAWS AND REGULATIONS, ACCOUNTABILITY FOR ENVIRONMENTAL VIOLATORS AND RESPONSIBLE PARTIES FOR CONTAMINATION, IMPROVED AIR QUALITY AND AIR QUALITY STANDARDS, WATER QUALITY STANDARDS PROTECTIVE OF THE PUBLIC HEALTH AND ECOSYSTEMS, SAFE DRINKING WATER AND RELIABLE WATER INFRASTRUCTURE, CLEAN UP AND RESTORATION OF LAND FOR PRODUCTIVE USES, AND WASTE REDUCTION AND PREVENTION OF ENVIRONMENTAL CONTAMINATION. THESE EFFORTS WILL REDUCE RISK, IMPROVE ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION, AND RESTORE AND SUPPORT HEALTHY ECOSYSTEMS AND ECONOMIES. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS AGREEMENT ARE THE CITIZENS OF THE STATE OF MISSISSIPPI.

THIS AGREEMENT WILL FUND STATEWIDE PROGRAMS TO SUPPORT AIR, WATER, AND LAND. ACTIVITIES PERFORMED INCLUDE BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO, ISSUING PERMITS; CONDUCTING INSPECTIONS; EVALUATING COMPLIANCE; PROVIDING TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE; REPORTING DATA; MONITORING AIR QUALITY; AND TAKING ENFORCEMENT ACTIONS. EXPECTED OUTPUTS/OUTCOMES INCLUDE TIMELY AND APPROPRIATE ENFORCEMENT ACTIONS; FACILITIES HAVING ADEQUATE PERMITS AND CONTROLS IN PLACE, COLLECTING, AND REPORTING QUALITY DATA, ALL TO SUPPORT THE GOAL OF A CLEANER, HEALTHIER ENVIRONMENT. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES ARE THE CITIZENS OF THE STATE OF MISSISSIPPI. NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION PROVIDES FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $1,781,540.00 TO KENTUCKY ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENT CABINET FOR THEIR CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS WHILE GIVING IT GREATER FLEXIBILITY TO ADDRESS ITS HIGHEST ENVIRONMENTAL PRIORITIES, IMPROVE ENVIRONMENTAL PERFORMANCE, ACHIEVE ADMINISTRATIVE SAVINGS AND STRENGTHEN THE PARTNERSHIP BETWEEN KENTUCKY AND EPA. THIS AGREEMENT WILL FUND STATEWIDE PROGRAMS TO SUPPORT AIR, WATER, AND LAND. THIS ACTION ALSO PROVIDES EPA IN-KIND FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $ 212,352 FOR CONTRACT 68HERH22D0002 (NATIONAL HAZARDOUS AIR POLLUTANTS SUPPORT) FOR WORK REQUESTED BY KENTUCKY AS PART OF THEIR PERFORMANCE PARTNERSHIP GRANT. WORK ACTIVITIES INCLUDE AIR TOXICS MONITORING 'SAMPLE ANALYSIS' FOR SAMPLES COLLECTED BY KENTUCKY AT TWO SPECIFIC AIR MONITORING SITES.ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES PERFORMED INCLUDE BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO ISSUING, PERMITS, CONDUCTING INSPECTIONS, EVALUATING COMPLIANCE, ENFORCEMENT ACTIONS, MONITORING AND DATA REPORTING, AND PROVIDING TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE FOR CLEAN AIR ACT SECTION 105; TOXIC SUBSTANCE COMPLIANCE MONITORING (TSCA SECTION 404(G)); PUBLIC WATER SYSTEM SUPERVISION (SAFE DRINKING WATER ACT SECTIONS 1443(A) AND 1451(A)(3)); WATER POLLUTION CONTROL (CWA 106); NONPOINT SOURCE MANAGEMENT (CWA 319); UNDERGROUND WATER SOURCE PROTECTION (SDWA SECTION 1443(B)); BROWNFIELDS STATE AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM GRANTS (COMPREHENSIVE ENVIRONMENTAL RESPONSE, COMPENSATION, AND LIABILITY ACT OF 1980, SECTION 128(A), AS AMENDED; PUBLIC LAW 107-118; SMALL BUSINESS LIABILITY RELIEF AND BROWNFIELDS REVITALIZATION ACT); ENVIRONMENTAL INFORMATION NETWORK EXCHANGE GRANTS (CONSOLIDATED APPROPRIATIONS RESOLUTION FOR THE DEPARTMENTS OF VETERANS AFFAIRS, HOUSING AND URBAN DEVELOPMENT, AND INDEPENDENT AGENCIES OF 2003,PUBLIC LAW 108-7; AND POLLUTION PREVENTION GRANTS PROGRAM (POLLUTION PREVENTION ACT SECTION 6605).SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND OUTPUT/OUTCOMES INCLUDE TIMELY AND APPROPRIATE ENFORCEMENT ACTIONS, FACILITIES HAVING ADEQUATE PERMITS AND CONTROLS IN PLACE, COLLECTING AND REPORTING QUALITY DATA, ALL TO SUPPORT THE GOAL OF A CLEANER, HEALTHIER ENVIRONMENT. THESE EFFORTS WILL REDUCE RISK, IMPROVE ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION, AND RESTORE AND SUPPORT RECREATIONAL AND PUBLIC HEALTH ISSUES THAT CONTRIBUTE TO HEALTHY ECONOMIES. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM ARE THE CITIZENS OF THE STATE OF KENTUCKY.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR THE OPERATION OF THE AQUINNAH WAMPANOAG TRIBE'S CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS WHILE GIVING IT GREATER FLEXIBILITY TO ADDRESS ITS HIGHEST ENVIRONMENTAL PRIORITIES, IMPROVE ENVIRONMENTAL PERFORMANCE, ACHIEVE SAVINGS AND STRENGTHEN THE PARTNERSHIP BETWEEN THE AQUINNAH WAMPANOAG TRIBE AND EPA. THIS AGREEMENT FUNDS TRIBAL CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS FOR AIR AND WATER.ACTIVITIES:THIS GRANT PROVIDES FUNDING TO MAINTAIN CAPACITY AND IMPLEMENT PROGRAMS AT THE TRIBE, INCLUDING CLEAN AIR ACT, SECTION 105 MONITORING AND WORK DONE UNDER THE CLEAN WATER ACT, SECTIONS 106 AND 319. THIS PERFORMANCE PARTNERSHIP GRANT ADDRESSES ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES AND ADMINISTRATIVE SUCCESS. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE WORK INCLUDES OUTPUTS AND OUTCOMES ASSOCIATED WITH MANAGING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS, AND THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND OUTCOMES INCLUDE THE COLLECTION AND REPORTING OF  AIR AND WATER QUALITY DATA, AND WATER QUALITY IMPROVEMENTS.
