DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS PERFORMANCE PARTNERSHIP GRANT (PPG) IS FOR THE UNITED SOUTH AND EASTERN TRIBES TO PROVIDE TRAINING TO THE TRIBAL NATIONS. THE PUBLIC WATER SYSTEMS SUPERVISION (PWSS) FUNDS WILL PROVIDE CERTIFICATION TRAINING FOR NEW OPERATORS AND SUPPORT OPERATOR ADVANCEMENT IN EARNING CONTINUING EDUCATION UNITS. THE WETLAND PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT GRANTS (WPDG) FUNDING WILL ASSIST THE TRIBAL NATIONS IN DEVELOPING AN EPA APPROVED WETLAND PROGRAM PLANS (WPP).

 ACTIVITIES:THESE FUNDS WILL BE USE TO PROVIDE TRIBAL NATIONS WITH TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE. THIS PROJECT IS INTENDED TO SUPPORT THE UNITED SOUTH AND EASTERN TRIBE TO PROVIDE TRAINING TO THE TRIBAL NATIONS TO CONTINUE TO BUILD CAPACITY IN THEIR ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS WHILE GIVING GREATER FLEXIBILITY TO ADDRESS THE HIGHEST ENVIRONMENTAL PRIORITIES, IMPROVE ENVIRONMENTAL PERFORMANCE, ACHIEVE ADMINISTRATIVE SAVINGS AND STRENGTHEN THE PARTNERSHIP WITH EPA. THIS AGREEMENT INCLUDE FUNDS FOR PUBLIC WATER SYSTEMS SUPERVISION (PWSS) AND WETLAND PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT GRANTS (WPDG). THE ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE 1) PUBLIC WATER SYSTEMS SUPERVISION (PWSS) CERTIFICATION TRAINING FOR NEW OPERATORS AND FOR OPERATOR ADVANCEMENT, REGIONAL TRAINING VIA THE TRIBAL UTILITY SUMMIT TO SUPPORT TRIBAL NATIONS OPERATORS IN EARNING CONTINUING EDUCATION UNITS, REGULATORY BRIEFINGS, WEBINARS, AND ON-SITE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND TRAINING. 2) WETLAND PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT GRANTS (WPDG) UNITED SOUTH AND EASTERN TRIBES WILL WORK WITH THE TRIBAL NATIONS IN CREATING AN EPA APPROVED WETLAND PROGRAM PLAN (WPP) USING EPA CORE ELEMENTS FRAMEWORK. THIS WILL INCLUDE SUPPORT WORKING GROUP MEETINGS, TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND CONDUCTING WETLAND DELINEATIONS. 





SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:EXPECTED DELIVERABLES FOR THE WETLAND PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT GRANT (WPDG) IS TO CREATE WETLAND PROGRAM PLAN (WPP) BY PROVIDING TRAINING TO THE TRIBAL NATIONS STAFF TO CONDUCT WETLAND DELINEATIONS. WETLAND DELINEATIONS ARE A KEY COMPONENT IN DEVELOPING A WPP, USING THE EPA CORE ELEMENTS FRAMEWORK. THE UNITED SOUTH AND EASTERN TRIBES WILL SUPPORT THE PROGRAM STAFF DURING THAT PROCESS AND, AS NEEDED, SUPPORT THEM WHEN THEY SEEK APPROVAL OF THEIR WETLAND PROGRAM PLAN (WPP) FROM THEIR TRIBAL COUNCIL AND/OR EPA. THEY WILL ALSO ASSIST WITH MAPPING WHICH WOULD DISPLAY BASELINE WETLAND EXTENT, SO THAT WETLANDS CAN BE CONSIDERED AND PROTECTED, PARTICULARLY DURING DEVELOPMENT PLANNING PHASES.  THE EXPECTED OUTCOME FOR THE PUBLIC WATER SYSTEM SUPERVISION (PWSS) FUNDING IS TO PROVIDE TRAINING FOR NEW OPERATORS AND FOR OPERATOR ADVANCEMENT, REGIONAL TRAINING THROUGH THE TRIBAL UTILITY SUMMIT THIS WILL INCLUDE REGULATORY BRIEFINGS,  WEBINARS, SITE VISITS, AND ON-SITE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND TRAINING.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR THE OPERATION OF THE VERMONT DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH'S CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS WHILE GIVING IT GREATER FLEXIBILITY TO ADDRESS ITS HIGHEST ENVIRONMENTAL PRIORITIES, IMPROVE ENVIRONMENTAL  PERFORMANCE, ACHIEVE ADMINISTRATIVE SAVINGS AND STRENGTHEN THE PARTNERSHIP BETWEEN VERMONT DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY (EPA). THIS AGREEMENT FUNDS STATEWIDE PROGRAMS TO:  

- SUPPORT THE STATE OF VERMONT IN THE ADMINISTRATION OF THE LEAD-BASED PAINT ACCREDITATION PROGRAM, TRAINING INDIVIDUALS, AND ESTABLISHING WORK PRACTICE STANDARDS IN RESIDENTIAL HOUSING BUILT BEFORE 1978.  THE TRAINING OF INDIVIDUALS ENGAGED IN LEAD-BASED PAINT ABATEMENTS, ACCREDITATION OF TRAINING PROVIDERS, AND CERTIFICATION OF CONTRACTORS WILL RESULT IN A REDUCTION OF EXPOSURE TO LEAD RESULTING IN IMPROVED PUBLIC HEALTH.

- SUPPORT VERMONT IN DEVELOPING AND MAINTAINING COMPLIANCE MONITORING PROGRAMS TO PREVENT OR ELIMINATE UNREASONABLE RISKS TO HEALTH OR THE ENVIRONMENT ASSOCIATED WITH CHEMICAL SUBSTANCES OR MIXTURES IN THEIR COMMUNITIES. SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL CONDUCT LEAD-BASED PAINT INSPECTIONS, ENCOURAGE REGULATORY ACTIVITIES WITHIN THE RECIPIENTS COMMUNITIES TO ESTABLISH THEIR OWN PROGRAMS FOR LEAD-BASED PAINT, AND PROVIDE FUNDS TO SUPPORT ENFORCEMENT ACTIVITIES FOR THE LEAD-BASED PAINT PROGRAM(S). 

THE WORK INCLUDES OUTPUTS AND OUTCOMES ASSOCIATED WITH MANAGING CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS WHICH INCLUDE ACTIVITIES TO PROTECT AND MAINTAIN CHEMICAL SAFETY.
ACTIVITIES:EDUCATION, OUTREACH, AND COMPLIANCE ASSISTANCE ON LEAD RULES 
-THE ALRP WILL RESPOND TO ALL EMAIL AND PHONE CALL INQUIRIES FROM THE TARGET AUDIENCE IN A TIMELY MANNER.  RESPONSES WILL BE PROVIDED BY ALL MEMBERS OF THE ALRP TEAM WITH MOST RESPONSES DELIVERED BY THE HEALTH ASBESTOS LEAD ENGINEERS AND THE ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH SPECIALIST.  THE CALL LOGS WILL BE SENT QUARTERLY TO THE U.S. EPA.  
-THE ALRP WILL SEND A YEARLY MEMO TO ALL LEAD ABATEMENT AND RRP LICENSEES AND ACCREDITED TRAINERS.  THE EMAIL WILL BE SENT BY THE ALRP PROGRAM MANAGER.  
SUCCESS WILL BE MEASURED BY SENDING EMAIL TO ALL LICENSEE CONTACTS BY THE TIMELINE DATE AND RESPONDING TO ALL INQUIRIES WHICH RESULT FROM THE COMMUNICATION. 
-THE ALRP WILL UPDATE LEAD-BASED PAINT INFORMATION SHEETS INTENDED FOR DISTRIBUTION TO REGULATED FIRMS AND CONTRACTORS, LANDLORDS, RENTERS, HOMEOWNERS, CHILDCARE PROVIDERS.  INFORMATION SHEETS WILL BE UPDATED BY THE ALRP PROGRAM MANAGER IN COLLABORATION WITH THE ALRP AND HHLPPPF.   SUCCESS WILL BE MEASURED BY REVIEW AND FINALIZATION OF THE INFORMATION SHEETS BY THE VDH COMMUNICATIONS TEAM. 

ACCREDITATION AND LICENSING OF LEAD TRAINING PROFESSIONALS 
-LICENSE PROCESSING : IN ACCORDANCE WITH STATUTORY AND REGULATORY REQUIREMENTS, LICENSES ASSOCIATED WITH LEAD-BASED PAINT DISCIPLINES AND LABS WILL BE RECEIVED AND PROCESSED BY THE ALRP PROGRAM TECHNICIAN AND HEALTH ASBESTOS LEAD ENGINEER WITHIN 25 DAYS OF RECEIPT OF A COMPLETE AND ACCEPTABLE APPLICATION. 
SUCCESS TRACKING: THE ALRP WILL PROVIDE QUARTERLY REPORTS TO THE EPA PROJECT OFFICER DETAILING THE NUMBER OF LICENSES/CERTIFICATIONS PROCESSED PER QUARTER AND PERCENT PROCESSED ON TIME. 
- LEAD-BASED PAINT TRAINING COURSE ACCREDITATION : IN ACCORDANCE WITH STATUTORY AND REGULATORY REQUIREMENTS, APPLICATIONS FOR RRP AND LEAD ABATEMENT DISCIPLINES TRAINING COURSE ACCREDITATION WILL BE RECEIVED AND PROCESSED BY THE ALRP PROGRAM TECHNICIAN WITHIN 25 DAYS OF RECEIPT OF A COMPLETE AND ACCEPTABLE APPLICATION. 
SUCCESS TRACKING: THE ALRP WILL PROVIDE QUARTERLY REPORTS TO THE EPA PROJECT OFFICER DETAILING THE NUMBER OF COURSE ACCREDITATIONS PROCESSED PER QUARTER AND PERCENT PROCESSED ON TIME. 

LEGISLATIVE AND REGULATORY UPDATES
-THE ALRP WILL ENFORCE THE UPDATED DUST LEAD HAZARD STANDARDS OF 10 MICROGRAMS OF LEAD IN DUST PER SQUARE FOOT ON FLOORS AND 100 MICROGRAMS OF LEAD IN DUST PER SQUARE FOOT ON INTERIOR WINDOWSILLS. THIS WORK IS PERFORMED BY THE

DESCRIPTION:THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT WILL BE TO ASSIST THE HHLPPP IN GOVERNING LEAD-BASED  PAINT  ACTIVITIES  TO  ENSURE  THAT  INDIVIDUALS  ENGAGED  IN  SUCH  ACTIVITIES  ARE  PROPERLY TRAINING, THAT THE TRAINING PROGRAMS ARE ACCREDITED AND THAT CONTRACTORS ENGAGED IN SUCH ACTIVITIES ARE CERTIFIED.  IN ACCORDANCE WITH TOXIC SUBSTANCES COMPLIANCE ACT (TSCA) 402(A) FUNDS OBTAINED FROM THE EPA WILL SPECIFICALLY BE USED TO: MAINTAIN AND UPDATE AS NECESSARY ENABLING LEGISLATION; MAINTAIN AND UPDATE AS NECESSARY IMPLEMENTING REGULATIONS; MAINTAIN  AND  UPDATE  AS NECESSARY  WORK  PRACTICE  STANDARDS  FOR  THE  CONDUCT  OF  LEAD-BASED PAINT ACTIVITIES; MAINTAIN AND UPDATE AS NECESSARY LEAD HAZARDS STANDARDS AND CLEARANCE STANDARDS FOR LEAD IN SOIL, DUST AND PAINT; MAINTAIN AND UPDATE AS NECESSARY LEAD-BASED PAINT PROGRAM REGULATIONS OR PROCEDURES FOR DECERTIFICATION, SUSPENSION, REVOCATION OR MODIFICATION OF APPROVALS AND CERTIFICATES; AND MAINTAIN  AND  UPDATE  AS  NECESSARY  REQUIREMENTS  FOR  THE  ADMINISTRATION  OF  A  THIRD-PARTY CERTIFICATION EXAM; GRANT MANAGEMENT AND REPORTING ACTIVITIES. ACTIVITIES:LEADERSHIP
1.1. MAINTAIN THE NH RSA 130-A STATUTE SO THAT NEW HAMPSHIRE REMAINS AN AUTHORIZED LEAD STATE PROGRAM AND MEET THE REQUIREMENTS OF TSCA SECTION 404(G).
1.2. MAINTAIN AND REVISE, AS NEEDED, THE HE-P 1600 ADMINISTRATIVE RULES THAT INCLUDE REGULATIONS FOR LICENSING, WORK PRACTICE STANDARDS, LEAD HAZARD CONTROL, CLEARANCE STANDARDS AND COMPLIANCE AUDITS FOR THE CONDUCT OF LEAD-BASED PAINT ACTIVITIES.
1.3. MAINTAIN AND EXPAND WHERE NECESSARY, THE HHLPPP STAFF AND TRAINING NEEDED FOR ADMINISTRATION OF A SUCCESSFUL STATE LICENSING AND CERTIFICATION PROGRAM.
1.4. MAINTAIN AND REVISE, AS NEEDED, STANDARD OPERATING PROCEDURES FOR THE ENFORCEMENT OF LEAD BASED PAINT ACTIVITIES INCLUDING LICENSING, COMPLIANCE, AND INVESTIGATIONS.
1.5. MAINTAIN AND REVISE, AS NEEDED, REQUIREMENTS FOR THE ADMINISTRATION OF A THIRD-PARTY CERTIFICATION EXAM.

PARTNERSHIPS
2.1 CONTINUE TO PARTICIPATE IN THE CHILDHOOD LEAD STAKEHOLDERS GROUP TO ENSURE ACTIVITIES OF THE GROUP ALIGN WITH HE-P 1600 AND RSA-130-A AND TO ENSURE THE GROUP IS AWARE OF OTHER LEAD REGULATIONS INCLUDING THE EPA RENOVATION, REPAIR, AND PAINTING RULE.
2.2. CONTINUE TO PARTICIPATE IN THE NEW ENGLAND LEAD COORDINATING COMMITTEE AND THE CONSORTIUM OF NORTHEAST STATES AND TRIBES TO ALIGN COLLABORATION STRATEGIES, PROGRAM NEEDS,
AND REQUIREMENTS OF NEIGHBORING STATES RECEIVING EPA GRANT FUNDING.
2.3. CONTINUE TO COLLABORATE REGULARLY WITH HUD LEAD HAZARD CONTROL GRANTEES TO ENSURE ALL ABATEMENT WORK SITES USING HUD FUNDS IS COMPLETED USING LICENSED AND CERTIFIED INDIVIDUALS THAT FOLLOW NH REGULATIONS.
2.4. CONTINUE TO COLLABORATE WITH THE EPA REGION 1 LEAD ACTION PARTNERSHIP TO ENSURE ALL NH OUTREACH AND ACTIVITIES PROVIDE PROPER LANGUAGE REGARDING NH'S LEAD REGULATIONS AND THE  CERTIFICATION AND TRAINING OF THE LICENSED LEAD COMMUNITY.

REPORTING 
3.1. DOCUMENT AND TRACK ALL INSPECTIONS INCLUDING PICTURES, INSPECTION FORMS, AND OUTCOMES, AS NEEDED, IN ACCORDANCE WITH HE-P 1600.
3.2. REPORT TO EPA REGION 1, 100% OF THE COMPLIANCE INSPECTIONS AND SITE VISITS THE HHLPPP HAS CONDUCTED OF LICENSED LEAD PROFESSIONALS. 
3.3. SUBMIT UPDATES ON WORK PLAN ACTIVITIES TO EPA REGION 1 GRANT PROJECT OFFICER AT THE END OF YEAR 1.
3.4. SUBMIT A COMPREHENSIVE REPORT TO THE EPA AT THE END OF THE PROJECT PERIOD WHICH MEETS THE REQUIREMENTS OF 40CFR 745.324(H).
3.5. SUBMIT QUARTERLY, OR AS REQUESTED BY EPA REGION 1 GRANT PROJECT OFFICER ACS NUMBERS. 10/1/2022-9/30/2024 OECA
3.6. SUBMIT QUARTERLY, OR AS REQUESTED BY EPA REGION 1 GRANT PROJECT OFFICER EPA'S 10-COLUMN TABLE.
3.7. PROGRAM STAFF TO MEET ANNUALLY WITH REGION 1 EPA GRANT PROJECT OFFICER TO DISCUSS WORK PLAN, BUDGET, ACCOMPLISHMENTS AND BARRIERS. 

COMPLIANCE AND ENFORCEMENT 
4.1 CONDUCT POST WORK COMPLIANCE INSPECTIONS BY REVIEWING 100% OF ALL CLEARANCE REPORTS SUBMITTED BY LICENSED LEAD

DESCRIPTION:THE MISSION OF THE CT DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC HEALTH'S LPPP (LEAD POISONING PREVENTION PROGRAM) IS TO PROTECT THE HEALTH AND SAFETY OF THE PEOPLE OF CONNECTICUT. THE LPPP STRIVES TO PREVENT LEAD POISONING AND PROMOTE WELLNESS THROUGH EDUCATION AND A WIDE RANGE OF PROGRAM ACTIVITIES THAT RELATED TO LEAD POISONING PREVENTION, SPECIFICALLY CHILDHOOD LEAD POISONING PREVENTION.  THE FUNDING MADE AVAILABLE BY THE US EPA UNDER THE TOXIC SUBSTANCES AND CONTROL ACT (TSCA) SECTION 404(G) ENABLES THE CT DPH TO CARRY OUT AN AUTHORIZED LEAD-BASED PAINT ACTIVITIES PROGRAM AND SUPPORT THE PROGRAMMATIC DUTIES OF THE LPPP AND THE ENVIRONMENTAL PRACTITIONER LICENSURE PROGRAM (EPLP).  THIS WORK PLAN DESCRIBES THE ACTIVITIES THAT WILL BE CARRIED OUT OVER THE DURATION OF THIS GRANT PERIOD. DESCRIPTION:THE RHODE ISLAND DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH (RIDOH) HAS THE DELEGATION OF AUTHORITY FROM THE US ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY (EPA) TO CARRY OUT AN AUTHORIZED LEAD-BASED PAINT (LBP) ACTIVITIES PROGRAM. RI IS A STATE IMPLEMENTATION JURISDICTION FOR EPA'S TSCA SECTION 402(A) LEAD-BASED PAINT ACTIVITIES, CERTIFICATION, AND TRAINING RULE (ABATEMENT RULE); TSCA SECTION 402(C)(3) RENOVATION, REPAIR, AND PAINTING RULE (RRP-RULE): AND TSCA SECTION 406(B) PRE-RENOVATION EDUCATION RULE (PRE-RULE). COLLECTIVELY, EPA REFERS TO THESE PROGRAMS AS THE RIDOH LBP PROGRAM. THIS GRANT PROPOSAL IS INTENDED TO INCLUDE THE DELIVERABLES FOR THESE PROGRAMS AS ONE COMPREHENSIVE ENVIRONMENTAL LEAD PROGRAM. 

COMPLIANCE MONITORING HAS ACCESS TO A HOST OF STATUTORY MECHANISMS FOR ENFORCEMENT. IN ADDITION TO RIDOH'S GENERAL ENFORCEMENT POWERS (216-RICR-50-15-3), THE LEAD POISONING PREVENTION ACT (RIGL 23-24.6) PROVIDES THE AUTHORITY TO LEVY ADMINISTRATIVE FINES; ISSUE IMMEDIATE STOP-WORK ORDERS; AND LIMIT, SUSPEND, AND/OR REVOKE A RIDOH ISSUED LICENSE. REPEAT OFFENDERS ARE TREATED MORE HARSHLY THAN INADVERTENT FIRST-TIME VIOLATORS. COMPLIANCE ASSURANCE ALSO HAS ACCESS TO THE ENFORCEMENT PROVISIONS IN THE STATE HOUSING MAINTENANCE AND OCCUPANCY CODE AND ASSISTANCE WITH DISCIPLINING UNLICENSED OR UNREGISTERED FIRMS AND WORKERS THROUGH THE RI CONTRACTORS REGISTRATION BOARD, WHICH CAN AUTHORIZE FINES OF $5,000. ALTHOUGH MOST OF OUR ENFORCEMENT IS CIVIL IN NATURE, RIDOH IS PERMITTED TO PURSUE CRIMINAL PENALTIES IN EGREGIOUS SITUATIONS. ACTIVITIES:THE CENTER FOR HEALTHY HOMES AND ENVIRONMENT (CHHE) IS PART OF THE DIVISION OF ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH (EH) AT THE RHODE ISLAND DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH (RIDOH) WHICH OVERSEES LEAD-RELATED RESPONSIBILITIES. CHHE CONSISTS OF THE FOLLOWING SIGNIFICANT EFFORTS:; HEALTHY HOMES AND CHILDHOOD LEAD POISONING PREVENTION PROGRAM (HHCLPPP); HEALTHY SCHOOLS AND COMMUNITIES PROGRAM; ; ENVIRONMENTAL LEAD COMPLIANCE AND ENFORCEMENT, CERTIFICATION, AND LICENSING; LEAD HAZARD MITIGATION PROGRAM (LHMP), AND LEAD-BASED PAINT PROGRAM (LBPP). 

LEAD EXPOSURE PERSISTS IN BEING A PERSISTENT ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH THREAT. RIDOH'S LEAD DEPARTMENT HAS EVOLVED INTO A 3-TIER APPROACH TO ADDRESS RI'S RESIDENTS' EXPOSURE TO LEAD. 

LEAD-BASED PAINT PROGRAM (LBPP) 

LEAD HAZARD MITIGATION PROGRAM (LHMP) 

HEALTHY HOMES AND CHILDHOOD LEAD POISONING PREVENTION PROGRAM (HHCLPPP) 

THIS STRATEGY MAXIMIZES DIFFERENT BRAIDS OF FUNDING AND LEVERAGES PARTNERSHIPS TO INCREASE PRIMARY AND SECONDARY LEAD POISONING PREVENTION ACTIVITIES. RIDOH'S ACTIONS FOCUS ON ENDING DISPARITIES BY SOCIAL DEMOGRAPHIC AND GEOGRAPHICAL FACTORS. LEAD PERSONNEL STRIVES TO TAKE PUBLIC HEALTH ACTION TO IMPROVE HEALTH EQUITY BY IMPLEMENTING AND EXPANDING EFFORTS TO INCREASE BLOOD LEAD TESTING, ESCALATING SURVEILLANCE EFFORTS, AND ENHANCING LINKING LEAD-EXPOSED CHILDREN AND PREGNANT INDIVIDUALS TO RECOMMENDED SERVICES. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:-INCREASE THE IDENTIFICATION OF LEAD HAZARDS AND INTERIM CONTROLS, DECREASE IN INCIDENCE RATES, INCREASE IN PROPERTY OWNER COMPLIANCE 
-DECREASE IN THE DURATION OF LEAD EXPOSURE OF YOUNG CHILDREN AND PREGNANT INDIVIDUALS, INCREASE THE NUMBER OF PROPERTIES THAT ARE BEING ASSESSED CORRECTLY 
-A STREAMLINED PROCESS FOR LEAD LICENSE RENEWALS 
-EXPANSION OF LEAD PROFESSIONAL WORKFORCE, AN INCREASE IN LEAD-SAFE WORK PRACTICES, AN INCREASE OF UNITS COMPLYING WITH THE LEAD HAZARD MITIGATION ACT, INCREASE IN THE NUMBER OF PROPERTIES WITH VALID LEAD CERTIFICATES 
-A BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF REQUIREMENTS FOR THE REGULATED COMMUNITY, INCREASED DEMAND FOR LEAD INSPECTORS AND LEAD ASSESSORS, INCREASED DEMAND FOR LICENSED LEAD WORKERS AND FIRMS 
- A COMPREHENSIVE RESOURCE FOR THE PUBLIC, RESEARCHERS, STUDENTS, AND THE REGULATED COMMUNITY TO RECEIVE INFORMATION REGARDING LEAD-BASED PAINT, THE LEAD PROGRAM WEB PAGE PROVIDES THE PUBLIC WITH 24/7 ACCESS FOR VERIFICATION OF LICENSES, NOTI

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR THE OPERATION OF THE HOULTON BAND OF MALISEET INDIANS CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS WHILE GIVING IT GREATER FLEXIBILITY TO ADDRESS ITS HIGHEST ENVIRONMENTAL PRIORITIES, IMPROVE ENVIRONMENTAL PERFORMANCE, ACHIEVE SAVINGS AND STRENGTHEN THE PARTNERSHIP BETWEEN HOULTON BAND OF MALISEET INDIAN AND EPA. THIS AGREEMENT FUNDS TRIBAL CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS FOR WATER, LAND, AND DATA QUALITY.ACTIVITIES:THE PROJECT WILL ALSO BUILD THE CAPACITY OF THE HOULTON BAND OF MALISEET INDIANS TO MAINTAIN AND OPERATE A NATURAL RESOURCE PROTECTION PROGRAMS THAT WILL INCLUDING TRAINING, EDUCATION AND OUTREACH, AND DATA COLLECTION ACTIVITIES TO IMPROVE ENVIRONMENTAL AND PUBLIC HEALTH CONDITIONS ON TRIBAL LANDS.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND OBJECTIVES WILL INCLUDE OUTPUTS AND OUTCOMES ASSOCIATED WITH MONITORING AND ANALYSIS OF WATER QUALITY AND EFFORTS TO REDUCE AND PREVENT NON-POINT SOURCE POLLUTION. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM ARE THE CITIZENS OF HOULTON BAND OF MALISEET INDIANS AND THE RESIDENTS OF MAINE.

DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM ARE THE TRIBAL MEMBERS AND THE CITIZENS OF THE STATE OF MAINE BY PROTECTING HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT.

THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR THE ILLINOIS DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE (IDA) TO CONTINUE THE RECIPIENT'S IMPLEMENTATION OF ITS PESTICIDE REGULATORY AND ENFORCEMENT PROGRAMS, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, ACTIVITIES SUCH AS: COMPLIANCE MONITORING, ENFORCEMENT, CERTIFICATION AND TRAINING FOR PESTICIDE APPLICATORS, AND OUTREACH AND EDUCATION.  THIS AGREEMENT WILL RESULT IN ENHANCED PROTECTION OF HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT (E.G. REDUCED PESTICIDE EXPOSURE TO AGRICULTURAL WORKERS AND HANDLERS, PROTECTION OF WATER RESOURCES FROM PESTICIDES, AND PROTECTION OF ENDANGERED SPECIES). DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR THE OPERATION OF THE KALISPEL TRIBE'S CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS WHILE GIVING IT GREATER FLEXIBILITY TO IMPROVE ENVIRONMENTAL PERFORMANCE, ACHIEVE ADMINISTRATIVE SAVINGS AND STRENGTHEN THE PARTNERSHIP BETWEEN THE TRIBE AND EPA. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO CONTINUE DEVELOPING WATER AND AIR PROTECTION POLICIES, MAINTAIN WATER QUALITY DATABASES AND TRACKING, AND IMPROVE AIR QUALITY ON THE RESERVATION.ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED UNDER THIS GRANT AGREEMENT INCLUDE, BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO, CONTINUED MONITORING OF SITES FOR WATER FLOW, TEMPERATURE, PH, AND DISSOLVED OXYGEN, PARTICIPATING IN THE REVIEW OF DEVELOPING TOTAL MAXIMUM DAILY LOADS (TMDLS) FOR KALISPEL ABORIGINAL LANDS, TRANSFERRING REFUSE TO A CENTRAL TRANSFER STATION, REVIEWING AIR QUALITY ENVIRONMENTAL ASSESSMENTS, AND DEVELOPING TRIBAL CLIMATE PROTECTION THROUGH REDUCTIONS IN GREENHOUSE GAS EMISSIONS. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE COLLECTION OF RELIABLE WATER RESOURCE DATA AND ASSOCIATED DATA ENTRY, RESTORING RIPARIAN SITES WITH NATIVE PLANTS, DISTRIBUTING AIR QUALITY EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS TO THE KALISPEL TRIBAL COMMUNITY, SOLID WASTE MINIMIZATION AND RECYCLING, AND A REINED CLIMATE CHANGE ACTION PLAN AS APPROPRIATE, AMONG OTHERS. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS GRANT ARE TRIBAL MEMBERS.

THE AGREEMENT WILL MAINTAIN AND EXPAND FIELD WATER QUALITY MONITORING, COLLECT AND ANALYZE WATER SAMPLES, DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT TOTAL MAXIMUM DAILY LOADS (TMDL) PLANS, CONDUCT OUTREACH ON WATERSHED AND ECOSYSTEM MANAGEMENT. IT SUPPORTS RIPARIAN/SHORELINE RESTORATION; CONTINUES WATER QUALITY/WATERSHED  MANAGEMENT PLANNING AND ASSESSING WATER RESOURCE ISSUES; WETLAND RESTORATION PLANNING AND DEVELOPMENT; PROVIDE INPUT TO OTHER TRIBAL DEPARTMENTS PLANNING EFFORTS; CONTINUE COMMUNICATION WITH STATE AND FEDERAL AGENCIES AND BEGIN IMPLEMENTATION OF THE INTEGRATED SOLID WASTE MANAGEMENT PLAN.
